body: I've been taking these shots for many years now so I can attest to the fact that when it comes to simply keeping you awake all night and throughout the day. It's literally like taking multiple shots of espresso! You will be wired…!!! So fair warning, you're taking what amounts to a huge cup of coffee, along-side some other ingredients to keep you up, just know what you're getting into. I find 5-hour energy to be very effective when I have a late night of studying or in the morning after I’ve had a late night partying. It really helps me stay awake. However what they're not effective for is working out, and I’ve tried this, and it simply doesn’t compare to a traditional pre-workout.

body: Drink half now and the other half later, never exceeding one a day and occasionally going off it completely, and you'll be fine. Drink these things like water and you're asking for trouble. The idea that drinking more = more energy is a myth, demonstrable by the very yellow urine you'll see which is your body dumping the excess vitamins it didn't absorb and has no use for. I take them only occasionally when I'm really low on energy and it helps, but nothing beats a good night's sleep.
title: Your Mileage May Vary

body: I don't tend to buy things like this.  I have always relied on caffeine in coffee or soda when I was running low on energy.  As a chick, these darn hormones can leave you feeling like a wiped out zombie.  I bought this first when I was on my way from Seattle to Pullman to visit my daughter in college and was getting pretty hormonally sleepy halfway there.  Not like there are napping spots in desert farmland.  It worked great without giving you the jitters or making you have to pee every 5 minutes.  I have always kept them in my car since then.  Lately at work, I have found just a half bottle of these little beauties has really helped my energy and motivation as I have a very physically demanding job that doesn't respect a woman's hormones.  Has been a life saver.  Most flavors are pretty nasty, but this new Peach Mango is actually tolerable.  I'd recommend this to any and every hormonal woman out there.  Cheers!!

body: I don't like coffee, but have tried caffeine pills before, but this stuff is much better, and works quicker. The taste can be kinda bitter (I usually get grape, but have also tried orange and lemon when that was all the store had available), so I always chug it down in one gulp, and then either drink some other kind of flavored juice or chew gum to get rid of the taste. I only use it for general alertness, never as a substitute for sleep, to try to stay up late for whatever reason. It's mostly just to ward off that "blah" feeling that sometimes hits in the afternoon, so I'll drink a bottle sometime between 12-2pm. But never after 2pm, because I want to make sure that it's completely worn off by the evening, so it doesn't effect my sleep-cycle. Sometimes I'll drink one bottle first thing in the morning when I wake up. But then I make sure at least 5 hours have passed before taking another one that same day. Taken effectively, it works perfectly. TWO THUMBS UP!
title: THIS STUFF WORKS!

body: I work a desk job and my place of work typically gets a little slow and quiet in the afternoons.  There are afternoons when I find myself slowly losing concentration and, on rare occasions, find my eyelids drooping a bit.  Those are the days I use 5 Hour Energy.  I have heard some say they don't like the taste, but I have tried several flavors and haven't found any I don't like (though I DO wish there were a double fudge brownie flavor).  The energy boost is quick and noticeable, and I have yet to experience any sort of crash.
title: Great for a quick boost

body: My son used this drink when he was driving us for a round trip of a little better than 725 miles and had no problem getting drowsy. Since I start yawning about time I leave the drive way, I decided to try it when we recently drove 750 miles in 2 days.  It worked-I don't think I yawned a single time while driving.  Also, have tried it for meetings where I need to be "awake & alert" - worked there, too.  Recommend it but the cost is a little high, I think, but probably worth it.

They are easy to become dependent on, just like everything is if not taken in moderation. ​

The other 5 hour energy products have a too high caffine content for me. When I take the others my heart will race for hours until the caffine finally wears off. I like to use this product on days where I have to stay up late working on school work, because the B vitamins increase my brain function and for me it usually last for 12 hours.
title: It Works!

body: Like everything, some things work for some and some things don't. For a while it seemed to help me pretty quickly with the alertness, waking me up, and energy. I bought a few boxes and over the period of about 3 months used them on and off. To me they lost their effect quite quickly. I am not sure whether I got used them, whether it was in my head and never really worked (don't think this is the case), or whether they just stopped working...in my head. In the end I decided if it wasn't working for whatever reason, then why put it in my body.
title: ehhhhh

body: 5 Hour Energy Decaf is a great pick-me-up for 5-7 hours on days when I just need a an extra boost. I use 5 Hour Energy Decaf when I'm going to be driving a long distance or when I'm just needing an evening boost after several hours of physical or mental work. The taste is definitely quite citrusy, but tolerable. I'm not drinking it as a liquid treat, so that's not an issue at all, especially since there's only a swallow-and-a-half to gulp down. I'm an active male (play tennis 2-3 times weekly--singles and doubles), age 64, weight 160, height 5'8". I've tried the caffeinated version and don't appreciate the "bladder effect."
title: IT WORKS WELL! (Some of us don't want or need the caffeine.)

body: I am very sensitive to caffeine and apparently, also to B vitamins.  I basically cant have coffee, soda, or even a chocolate bar after 3pm or I wont sleep at night.  I use these before I go to the gym around noon, but at that point I already have 2 cups of coffee in me and if I have anymore caffeine then I'm going to get a case of the shakes and the poops, and nobody needs that.  So I drink one of these right before the gym and I can feel the energy hitting me 10-20 minutes later.  And oh man does this stuff make me sweat!  I mean I can run on the treadmill for a mile and work up a decent sweat, like 20% of my shirt is soaked in sweat; but when I take the decaf 5 hour energy 75% of my shirt is drenched.  But its worth it because it gives me the energy kick that I need for an awesome workout.
title: Seems like 2 hour energy, lots of sweating, then crash for 3 hours, then ok at the 5 hour mark

It tastes like slightly medicinal lemon aid, not intolerable at all. Does a nice job perking me up without making me feel edgy and shaky. Excellent stuff.

body: I'm not an avid energy drink taker.  In fact, I find a lot of the other drinks that claim to give you energy poor excuses for foul tasting beverages.  Red Bull and Monster, to me, taste horrible and on top of that do very little for me when it comes to the energy departments.  So, after a grueling night with the baby, a newborn, I saw one of these at the local gas station and decided to give it a try.  I will say, while not a homerun when it comes to taste, it wasnt bad.  That could be, though, because there isnt that much liquid to swallow, so the taste is a one time deal unlike with larger energy drinks.  The grape was not horrible.  Nor my preferred drink taste, but tolerable.  I will say this, their advertisements were pretty dead on.  It provided me an alert feeling with little to no jitters.  I was more awake and felt better suited for the day than I would have felt had I not taken the shot.  Also, I didnt feel a big crash when it wore off, more like a cooling of my body.  I will say this, I do not take one of these every day.  It is about a once every week or two thing for me, depending on how the baby slept. So, that is probably why it worked so well for me.  As with anything, if you take too much of it, your body will get used to it, and it will have a different effect. Also, I am not a huge soda drinker, so caffeine in any form will usually give me a jolt, but unlike with soft drinks or other caffeinated beverages, this lasted a good while and didnt spike me in any direction.  Highly recommend.
title: Works Great For Me

body: I am very careful not to overload.  I take one bottle per day.  1/2 in the morning and the other 1/2 around 3 pm. Keeps be going with out the caffeine jitters. I have taken them for about 1 year and feel they are very safe if one does not take more than on per day.

I've never experienced any adverse side effects e.g. jitters or quickened heart rate etc. It really does not make you crash, just like it says. The only caveat I would say is, that if you take it on an empty stomach, it may not help your energy levels much. It works best if you've eaten something recently.

body: Yes, it is a pick-me-up shot. Yes it has caffeine. But the way this energy drink is formulated, there's enough caffeine to simulate a cup of coffee intake, but somehow they have put it all together to completely avoid the crash afterwards. You have to appreciate that. In fact it makes you feel like you've had eight hours of sleep. It's impressive actually. No matter what the taste. Yes, the taste is slightly better than it was. But hey, coffee has that hard licorice taste and beet ain't much better. And those are some pretty big addictive habits we manage to work around the taste no, so why not soldier on through the taste of 5-hour? Just saying.

body: Nothing wrong with product, it does what it's supposed to and is at a good price on Amazon. After experiencing some odd symptoms I will use the extra strength once in awhile, if at all.  Would not recommend using it everyday as I developed shortness of breath type symptoms when used everyday for 2 weeks.  I felt normal again about a week later after discontinuing use.  I also used one bottle before doing an interval workout and nearly had a heart attack. Since then I've tried the regular versions and have not experienced the same type of symptoms as the extra strength, perhaps the extra strength is just more than my body needs.  Like any supplement have some common sense while using it.

body: I am in nursing school so my sleep is cut in half during the school year. I had several issues with my stomach and shakiness with coffee and although awake, I still felt super tired. It does not make me feel shaky, I don't experience palpitations, and best of all I feel awake and not tired. I don't recommend taking the whole bottle at once unless you really need. body: I don't tend to buy things like this.  I have always relied on caffeine in coffee or soda when I was running low on energy.  As a chick, these darn hormones can leave you feeling like a wiped out zombie.  I bought this first when I was on my way from Seattle to Pullman to visit my daughter in college and was getting pretty hormonally sleepy halfway there.  Not like there are napping spots in desert farmland.  It worked great without giving you the jitters or making you have to pee every 5 minutes.  I have always kept them in my car since then.  Lately at work, I have found just a half bottle of these little beauties has really helped my energy and motivation as I have a very physically demanding job that doesn't respect a woman's hormones.  Has been a life saver.  Most flavors are pretty nasty, but this new Peach Mango is actually tolerable.  I'd recommend this to any and every hormonal woman out there.  Cheers!!
title: Love this stuff!!!

body: This product is great and you get what the ads tell you about this product. You can definitely get through hours where you are extremely tired. Usually take it either in the afternoon to get through the rest of the day; small sip before a workout, half a bottle around 10PM when going out during the weekend. This product has a bit of an intense flavor - overall all of them do, so have some water ready as a chaser. This product will get you to a state like when you slept 10 hours and are bright awake and alert, however you wont have the jitters, shaky hands or anything like it. After the 5-6 hours it slowly fades away and you literally get back to the state you were at before taking this product - so there is no crash or anything. Aside from that your body will just extract this product after a bathroom run - it is not based on caffeine or taurine it actually works based on insane amounts of Vitamin B6 and B12 - one of them is at 8000% of your DV for food intake. Personally I have had great experience with it; though I have heard from people that they end up having to visit the bathroom due to some digestive issues.
title: Works as the ads say it does...

body: Energy drink with only 4 calories. It doesn't taste bad and it comes in a small shot bottle for single servings. I drink one bottle each morning as soon as I come into the office, and I can definitely tell when I forget to use one. One bottle each day is all I use, even if I'm really tired in the morning. title: When Nothing Else Works, Use This One

body: I must note that I am mildly sensitive to caffeine and usually very reserved on using energy drinks. This has been one of those rare products that delivers as advertised. I would rate this product toward what I use it for. I have always had difficulty getting up in the morning, no matter how long I sleep. I have heard of people using this as a replacement for their morning coffee and thought I should give it a try. Being that I am sensitive to caffeine  I tried only half a bottle the first morning and I have to say that within 5 minutes I felt what I would call a "natural" burst of energy. By "natural" I mean that I do not get the nasty jittery energy most competing products give you. For those who are sensitive to caffeine can relate to the slightly anxious and nausea inducing feeling most energy drinks give you,  this DOES NOT do that. Highly recommend this product for morning use, no crash at all. I would give this a perfect 5 if it wasn’t so darn expensive.
title: Great Product to get the gears running in the morning!

body: I am very sensitive to caffeine and apparently, also to B vitamins.  I basically cant have coffee, soda, or even a chocolate bar after 3pm or I wont sleep at night.  I use these before I go to the gym around noon, but at that point I already have 2 cups of coffee in me and if I have anymore caffeine then I'm going to get a case of the shakes and the poops, and nobody needs that.  So I drink one of these right before the gym and I can feel the energy hitting me 10-20 minutes later.  And oh man does this stuff make me sweat!  I mean I can run on the treadmill for a mile and work up a decent sweat, like 20% of my shirt is soaked in sweat; but when I take the decaf 5 hour energy 75% of my shirt is drenched.  But its worth it because it gives me the energy kick that I need for an awesome workout.
title: Seems like 2 hour energy, lots of sweating, then crash for 3 hours, then ok at the 5 hour mark

body: I'm not an avid energy drink taker.  In fact, I find a lot of the other drinks that claim to give you energy poor excuses for foul tasting beverages.  Red Bull and Monster, to me, taste horrible and on top of that do very little for me when it comes to the energy departments.  So, after a grueling night with the baby, a newborn, I saw one of these at the local gas station and decided to give it a try.  I will say, while not a homerun when it comes to taste, it wasnt bad.  That could be, though, because there isnt that much liquid to swallow, so the taste is a one time deal unlike with larger energy drinks.  The grape was not horrible.  Nor my preferred drink taste, but tolerable.  I will say this, their advertisements were pretty dead on.  It provided me an alert feeling with little to no jitters.  I was more awake and felt better suited for the day than I would have felt had I not taken the shot.  Also, I didnt feel a big crash when it wore off, more like a cooling of my body.  I will say this, I do not take one of these every day.  It is about a once every week or two thing for me, depending on how the baby slept. So, that is probably why it worked so well for me.  As with anything, if you take too much of it, your body will get used to it, and it will have a different effect. Also, I am not a huge soda drinker, so caffeine in any form will usually give me a jolt, but unlike with soft drinks or other caffeinated beverages, this lasted a good while and didnt spike me in any direction.  Highly recommend.
title: Works Great For Me

body: As a general rule, I stay clear of energy drinks and drinks with large doses of caffeine in them. However, there are occasions that I need some pep to keep me going - most often when I happen to be working a double shift or am required to work security during the night after just working that same day. In cases like those, 5-hour energy has helped me stay alert for the duration of my assignments. As the product states, there doesn't seem to be any "crash" after its effects wear off, which I really appreciate.
title: I don't recommend drinking energy drinks on a regular basis, but these are great for the times when you actually need the boost!

body: I drank the whole box in one sitting because I wanted 60 hours of energy. You've all have tried this product before, it's the exact same as buying it form the store, you know. The only thing was that buying in bulk allowed me to get a cheaper price per unit. But this product totally works. I'm still buzzing with productivity after two days! I've found a replacement for my morning pot of coffee and am going to start drinking a box of these when I'm taking my shower in the morning. It's great because it also suppresses my appetite! So it's like energy and breakfast, lunch, dinner for 2 and a half days at the low, low price of 25 bucks - which is less than price of three coffees from my local Starbucks. If you're looking for some energy that even Nikola Tesla wouldn't believe existed you have to try 5-hour energy. This stuff is potential energy than your mom in a roller coaster at it's apex, enough PE in a bottle that would blow Newton's mind and make Einstein rethink his theory of relativity because he has not tried to vaccuum with this much energy! My whole house is spotless and I still have enough energy left over to make Ra jealous!

The only thing I think is important to mention, is that for myself and my husband, whom is also in his 60's, we have noticed that the next day after taking it, we feel pretty lousy, and even more tired than we were before taking it. body: This is the go-to energy drink for this night owl on long road-trips. First, its compact size means that drinking isn't followed up by a couple of unwanted restroom stops. But most important, it really works, which is a mystery to me because the other energy drinks I tried didn't do much. 5 Hour Energy gives me a gentle but definite energy boost to keep driving alertly and safely. I usually sip about half the bottle, then follow up with more as I feel fatigued again. When it's finally time to sleep it doesn't keep me awake like caffeine would. The last time I stopped at a gas station to buy some the cashier said that it's the only one that works for him too, and he's tried them all. Don't know what they put in this stuff but it's great.
title: This is the go-to energy drink for this night owl on long road-trips.

body: I used to head to my local gas station and purchase the individual bottles at almost 3 bucks a piece. A friend told me that she buys them off amazon and they come out to half price! You can't beat that! I only like to drink energy shots when I am in NEED of a quick pick me up. I dislike having to take red bull, monster and all those drinks because of their size and high sugar content. I like the 5 hour drink because at 2 ounces and 4 calories, and no sugar, I can easily and conveniently throw it back and get on with my agenda. However, it does NOT last 5 hours, not for me at least. I drink it 20 minutes before an activity and I can get through it just fine, but maybe 2 hours or so tops. I'm satisfied with it, because that's normally all I need.

body: I don't like coffee, but have tried caffeine pills before, but this stuff is much better, and works quicker. The taste can be kinda bitter (I usually get grape, but have also tried orange and lemon when that was all the store had available), so I always chug it down in one gulp, and then either drink some other kind of flavored juice or chew gum to get rid of the taste. I only use it for general alertness, never as a substitute for sleep, to try to stay up late for whatever reason. It's mostly just to ward off that "blah" feeling that sometimes hits in the afternoon, so I'll drink a bottle sometime between 12-2pm. But never after 2pm, because I want to make sure that it's completely worn off by the evening, so it doesn't effect my sleep-cycle. Sometimes I'll drink one bottle first thing in the morning when I wake up. But then I make sure at least 5 hours have passed before taking another one that same day. Taken effectively, it works perfectly. TWO THUMBS UP!

body: I can honestly say that these shots are sometimes crutches for me when I feel like I'm about to just pass out. I'm majoring in Mechanical Engineering and these things are PHENOMENAL for when you need to get some late night studying done, or if you need some energy to focus on exams. It takes about ~20 minutes for me to feel the effects, and it lasts for 3-4 hours for me. I feel only slightly jittery, but there's a significant difference in the amount of focus you get from a 5 hour energy than your regular energy drink. I suppose the B vitamins are to thank for that! And of course, the best part... NO CRASH! I highly recommend these if you are a college student. They are VERY beneficial and will give you that extra boost and focus you need!

body: Pomegranate is the best tasting out of the Five-Hour Energy drinks.  I have been drinking these for quite some time now.  I only consume approx. half of a bottle and save the rest for later.  I enjoy consuming these during work or before an early morning workout when I may need that extra boost.  No GI side effects, no jitters, no headache.  I have not experienced not one adverse side effect.  The bottle states  that it is equivalent to one cup of coffee, but one cup of coffee would not produce the same amount of clear, pure energy that this drink provides.  Also, no sugar, which is a plus!  Highly recommended.
title: Best Taste

body: I drink one of these every day even if I don't really feel tired, because the vitamin B complex it has in it complements the diet of anyone who is vegan or doesn't eat much red meat. I used to take niacin pills before this but find the 5 hour energy is easier to take and does not cause flushing like niacin pills can. I've never experienced any adverse side effects e.g. jitters or quickened heart rate etc. It really does not make you crash, just like it says. The only caveat I would say is, that if you take it on an empty stomach, it may not help your energy levels much. It works best if you've eaten something recently.
title: Best of the lot as far as energy drinks go.

body: I've tried several energy products, both drinks and pills, and 5-hour energy is my favorite.  It certainly gives me a kick of energy but doesn't leave me jittery or anxious at all. It is convienent to use and take with me.  I usually keep me with me, one at home, and one in the office in case I hit a mid-day slump. I don't recommend it for any type of weight loss product but if you take it before you hit the gym, you'll get a boost for your workout. I can't take it after about 3:00pm though or I can't sleep at night (around 10pm). I like the pomegranate flavor, but can't stand the Berry flavor.
title: Really works

body: I've been using these regularly for a couple years now and they help me balance my natural energy and keep me more focused throughout the workday. Word of warning- don't chug them! I take sips on one or two throughout my shift (anywhere between 4PM and 3+AM) and it gives such a gradual energy that works absolutely perfect. I did take a hiatus or two and my energy was back to sporadic and short lived. These keep a nice flow of energy and I enjoy the flavor and feel of extra strength especially. Everyone's different, just please listen to your body when you take these. No one wants niacin flush in the middle of a conversation!
title: Great product- just sip on them!

body: My boss likes it
title: Five Stars

body: These are my "driving five hours late at night" or "reading a dozen papers and writing summaries" drinks. They're... potent. They have a somewhat unpleasant taste (some artificial sweetener, some strong acrid taste from the additives), but they kick the mind and body into gear. Definitely recommend if you simply MUST keep going. But I'd also recommend sleeping...
title: Definitely recommend if you simply MUST keep going

body: These little "drinks" are really the perfect energy boost. Like their commercials, I take these when I get that blah feeling at work after lunch. The taste is so tart and sour (which is great because I love sour things!) that I feel like it gives me an instant jolt just because the taste wakes you up a bit. Then minutes later I feel like I'm getting my second wind for the day. I don't take these daily, only when I'm literally debating taking a nap instead. Definitely a much better choice than any of the cans of energy drinks that make you jittery, bloated, and then crash. NO crash with these. They're great!
title: Best energy supplement I've had

body: I would really like to meet the person who create this, and shake his hand! This is the best thing you can use when you're "RUNNING OUT OF GAS"!  You don't "CRASH" when it wears off. Personally, I have never had the jitters, heart palpitations, or sweats like I have heard others state they have when using this. As a matter of fact, and it may sound funny, but I swear, I could set my watch by how I feel when it wears off, and it is "5" hours later!!!!  Orange is the best, but unavailable in the 6 pk. from AMAZON. One more suggestion....chill it first if you can.....tastes WAY better that way!
title: Beats Coffee

body: I do like Rockstars, I'll admit, but I don't think you can beat these 5 hour energies.  They just do their job without jacking you up high then crash low.  I like Grape the best, the others are a bit faker tasting.  I would have given 5 starts, but truthfully the fake sugar is nasty, but it's over in a few seconds or just get a water chaser.  I'm sure they'd be super nasty without fake sugar and real sugar makes you crash - can't have it both ways.  It's nice to have a stock of these in the bottom drawer for times of need.  Beats the hell out of prices at the store.
title: They Work. Period.  NO SUGAR CraSh

body: Like most of the reviews posted here, I give this product a positive rating. For me, it does what it claims to do... and I especially appreciate the "no crash" effect after a few hours! I first found out about this product when I started racing Go-Karts this year... I hit the local Stop-N-Shop before getting to the track and decided to plunk out the $3.00, as I was a bit tired. I threw it in my cooler and then drank it just prior to my qualifying session. Almost immediately, I could feel the "boost"... and it helped out on track! I never felt the Niacin rush that some claim, but the one thing I did notice, was that my jaw was a bit tight due to the jolt of energy. I only have few suggestions: I've tried all the flavors, and I think the Orange flavor is the best; I drink the product chilled... tastes better to me that way; the flavor is a bit too sweet for me so I add it into my personal water bottle; I buy this on amazon because it's a lot cheaper than buying it at my local Stop-N-Shop!
title: Professional Driver On A Closed Course! :-)

body: I work a desk job and my place of work typically gets a little slow and quiet in the afternoons.  There are afternoons when I find myself slowly losing concentration and, on rare occasions, find my eyelids drooping a bit.  Those are the days I use 5 Hour Energy.  I have heard some say they don't like the taste, but I have tried several flavors and haven't found any I don't like (though I DO wish there were a double fudge brownie flavor).  The energy boost is quick and noticeable, and I have yet to experience any sort of crash.
title: Great for a quick boost

body: This pink lemonade flavor of 5-hour energy drink is simply NOT AVAILABLE here in San Antonio, why I don't know. I wouldn't even have known it existed if I hadn't seen it advertised on TV.  I use 5-hour when I'm driving on long trips and need to stay away, and believe me, it works, though I don't actually get 5 hours, more like 3 I'd say. But still, it's better than anything else I've tried. But the taste of 5-hour is, uh, shall we say, less than desirable? That is, until this new lemonade flavor, which is great! So, yes, I recommend it!

I like the regular one as well as the extra, but the Berry flavor is pretty gross.  This new Grape flavor is much more acceptable!  Don't expect it to taste like a soft drink or something... but hey, it does the job and at least this one tastes a lot better!  5 stars for quality and working without making me crash like a ton of bricks!

I would recommend at least trying this to anyone who needs a quick energy boost without chugging a couple cups of coffee.

I look forward to shooting this each morning knowing that I am good until lunch at least and there is no crash to speak of.

body: This stuff is wonderful. I even talked to my pharmacy about it and they thought it was full of vitamins and fine to drink. I talked to my doctor about it and told her how it made me feel better. She said that she couldn't recommend it-since she is my doctor but she said it was full of vitamins and thought it was fine to be taking it. I am nervous about taking things over the counter so I wanted to double check with the my pharmacist and doctor. I now drink a whole bottle  each morning when I get to work. It works great for me. I have more energy and feel more positive. I have a SI Joint pain at the moment due to an injury and this has help me through it. I like the grape flavor. In my opinion this is a terrific product-not like sugar that your crash shortly after.
title: 5 Hour energy

body: 5-hour energy is great!  It works just like coffee in the morning does for me.  Awake, alert in a half hour, and it's less liquid.  But this product is not a substitute for sleep.  It does not really help alertness when I'm real tired and on the road.  For late night alertness, I don't count on 5-hour.  I do better with good tunes and a handful of almonds to nibble.
title: 5-hour Energy works for me, but not always

body: As someone who dislikes coffee and sometimes needs more caffeine than tea (and sometimes you dont want a whole cup of something) energy shots present a great option for me. 5 hour does a good job of reassuring us that it's safe. My independent googling confirms that claim. This is also by far my favorite flavor. This is like happy juice for me. Highly recommended.
title: Happy juice

body: I wanted to try this product to see what all the buzz was about with the "5 Hour Energy" drinks.  Seemed like everyone is using them.  I had trouble finding them in local stores, so I ordered this box from Amazon.  The price was good and there were no problems with the shipping.  There is only enough caffeine equivalent to one cup of coffee in each bottle.  I'm a huge coffee drinker, so this product did not work for me.  I did not feel any more energy when I needed it and it did not keep me awake or alert.  In fact, I got stomach cramps and diarrhea for several days after using this product.  I'm physically fit and do the P90X workouts. I eat healthy food and rarely have abnormal bowel movements or diarrhea.  As a test, I did not use this product for a week and felt fine with normal bowel movements.  I then used another 5 Hour Drink and the next day, diarrhea again!  It may work for other people, but it did not work for me!
title: Not for Me!

body: Having purchased these retail, its great to be able to purchase in bulk, and have it delivered.  Started using 5 Hour back in the spring, and its great.  Good pickme up, but more importantly, you don't suddenly crash in a few hours.  Works for me on the golf course, and at work, when the day goes a LOT longer than you expected.
title: Power to spare

body: This is not sour and has a nice apple taste. I hate the original 5 hour it taste bad. This one I didn't have heart racing or complications. The original I had complications. This has more natural ingredients. It has lots of B12 Vitamin for energy. I would recommend this and will buy lots more in the future. I received this very fast. I hope this was helpful.

Furthermore, I do not feel any type of crash when I drink them, I just feel nice and balanced. I hope they never change. In addition, my husband uses the extra, I however do not need it.

body: This product contains sodium benzoate as a preservative (as do many soft drinks and foods).  Combined with ascorbic acid (vitamin C), sodium benzoate produces benzene in our bodies (brains?).....not so great.  Sodium benzoate is taken care of by the liver, but appears to be linked to blood cancers and ADHD.  In small quantities, it is supposed to be safe.  But I would not want to use this product along with a daily dose of ascorbic acid vitamin C.  I wonder if the orange variety might have more potential problems than other flavors of this product, due to the vitamin C possibly present in orange flavoring;  I really do not know enough to determine this ... I cannot say.
title: Potentially not good for you????

body: I play in an adult ice hockey league that plays Friday nights at 10:30pm, and after working an 8 hour day that starts at 6:00 am, I didn't have the energy to play very well at all. I decided to try this 5 hour energy pack and took one an hour before the game. It starts waking you up about 10 minutes after you drink it, I had so much more energy, felt stronger, more sure footed, and could skate longer at a time and felt very focused and in the game. I never feel jittery, never crash, and I can go to sleep after showering when I get home (when I tried Red bull, I was up for HOURS and felt jittery).
title: Puts me to work!

body: This is the go-to energy drink for this night owl on long road-trips. First, its compact size means that drinking isn't followed up by a couple of unwanted restroom stops. But most important, it really works, which is a mystery to me because the other energy drinks I tried didn't do much. 5 Hour Energy gives me a gentle but definite energy boost to keep driving alertly and safely. I usually sip about half the bottle, then follow up with more as I feel fatigued again. When it's finally time to sleep it doesn't keep me awake like caffeine would. The last time I stopped at a gas station to buy some the cashier said that it's the only one that works for him too, and he's tried them all. Don't know what they put in this stuff but it's great.
title: This is the go-to energy drink for this night owl on long road-trips.

body: I've been drinking these little 5-hour energy drinks for a while now and I have to say that it's a great way to get a boost to your day. I was having a hard time waking up in the afternoons (you know, after lunch, the work day just drags sometimes and puts you to sleep) but taking one of these gave me the energy I needed to get through the days. I buy them bulk like this from Amazon because they're cheaper than buying them anywhere else. Although, I have been wondering lately what the long term disadvantages are to taking these on a regular basis.
title: Great way to wake up

body: I have a 5 - 6 hour commute every 2 weeks and this is great.  I don't drink these any other time and I always feel energized but not buzzed or jumpy.  I the winter I drive mostly in the dark and this is good insurance from nodding off at the wheel
title: 5 Hour Commute

body: As I have become older in age, I felt it became difficult to wake up energized and refreshed with just 5 or 6 hours of sleep. I rarely drank coffee before my 40's. When I say rare, I mean once or none a year. About a year ago, I tried coffee regularly in the mornings, however, it really did not give me a wake up boost, or if it did, it the feeling of alertness and energy lasted 30 minutes or so. Plus, coffee made me want to urinate due to the caffeine and volume of liquid intake. Also it stains the teeth. Therefore I decided to try the 5 hour energy. From day 1, it gave me the boost that I needed in the mornings. And it last for several hours, maybe not exactly 5, but the effects are longer lasting than coffee. It's simple to prepare. Just twist the cap off even with the wrapper in place and drink either the whole bottle or half. It's that quick. No boiling water, coffee filters, or waiting for the coffee to cool down.  Half a bottle is enough for me in the early morning, then I save the rest for later during the day. The 5 hour energy also doubles as  my pre-energy workout drink. It gives me the power boost I need to power through  my workouts even with 5 or less hours of sleep.
title: Better and cheaper than coffee

body: As a morning person, afternoons are usually not a creatively productive time for me.  I found that when I try to keep going by drinking coffee I sometimes experience drowsiness as though the caffeine has an opposite effect on me.  I tried a few of the different energy drinks and found that 5-Hour works best for me.  The taste is OK, but I'm not drinking it for the taste.  I also like the fact that you don't have to drink a 16 Oz can of fluid.  I don't use it every day but when I need to work into the evening, it keeps me alert, energized, and productive.  There is no after-effect that I can tell.  I fall asleep quickly and get a good night's rest after 5-6 hours.  Results may vary for different people, but this works for me.  The price is a bit steep but you can find pretty good deals if you shop around and buy in bulk.

body: For a couple of weeks now I've been drinking 5hr Energy, and they've worked pretty well for me. I started out with Pink Lemonade, but started buying Berry because they were 2/$5 at 7-11. When I ordered these, I wanted to try the Extra Strength to see if it is any different from the normal strength ones. However, I received 12 normal Berry flavored 5hr Energy drinks from the manufacturer, and they do not accept returns. To me this is false advertising and I am very unhappy. I could've bought the same amount of these same 5hr Energy drinks in 7-11 for almost the same price and NOT had to have waited 3 weeks for it to get here, only to be disappointed at what I got and not be able to do anything about it. Dissatisfied customer to say the least.

body: I've been taking these shots for many years now so I can attest to the fact that when it comes to simply keeping you awake all night and throughout the day. It's literally like taking multiple shots of espresso! You will be wired…!!! So fair warning, you're taking what amounts to a huge cup of coffee, along-side some other ingredients to keep you up, just know what you're getting into. I find 5-hour energy to be very effective when I have a late night of studying or in the morning after I’ve had a late night partying. It really helps me stay awake. However what they're not effective for is working out, and I’ve tried this, and it simply doesn’t compare to a traditional pre-workout.

body: Drink half now and the other half later, never exceeding one a day and occasionally going off it completely, and you'll be fine. Drink these things like water and you're asking for trouble. The idea that drinking more = more energy is a myth, demonstrable by the very yellow urine you'll see which is your body dumping the excess vitamins it didn't absorb and has no use for. I take them only occasionally when I'm really low on energy and it helps, but nothing beats a good night's sleep.
title: Your Mileage May Vary

This man is not the stereotypical "money above all else" businessman, and the sales of the product are making far more difference than most of its customers realize.

body: I could not imagine a day where i dont take one of these. they help me to think straight. like with other reviews, you dont take it in massive quantities. It advertises as having as much caffene as a large cup of premium coffee, but it's not just caffene in it and it specifically tells you to not exceed 2 a day. it even says take half for some energy and a full one for a lot. My point being if youre the kind of moron who thinks that it would be a great idea to pour a ton of these into a large cup and chug it, darwin has an award waiting for you in the light. back on point, this is a wonderful product for those who need caffene to wake up and keep you going. it does keep you alert and for some ive found helps to think more clearly. if you feel coffee doesnt do it for you before you try this, this product may do nothing for you as well. do not exceed the recomended dosages on the bottle.

body: Just what I expected. I figured we buy these enough, I might as well get a 6 pack. With Amazon Prime, I was able to purchase this cheaper online than I can locally. I like the 5 hour energy for those times I need to get through the afternoon blahs, or the times when my husband wants to drag me out for the night & need something to get me past 10 o'clock. Ha ha! These little babies work nicely for me, giving me the energy I need without the jitters. I find the regular shots can last for up to 6 hours or more for me. I haven't paid attention to how long the extra strength lasts. I mainly got the extra strength because I only like the berry flavor & I just can't seem to find this flavor in the regular strength. If you haven't used these before, understand any flavor you buy will have a pretty sour taste that hits you just after swallowing it. Good thing is, the sour taste leaves your mouth rather quickly. A chaser of water or soda helps. My husband can chug these shots quickly, but I am just not able to so that is why I probably notice the sour taste more than he does. Regardless of the sourness, I still go to these shots over any other shots because they work the best & last the longest.
title: Get the extra energy you need for hours on end without the jitters

body: I love this stuff. I'm highly sensitive to caffeine, so can't tolerate the standard version. But this one is just right. I buy it by the 12-pack, and use it for days when I need more oomph. But mostly I use it after trans-atlantic flights to Europe, when I need a boost after landing to counteract jet-lag, or first thing the next morning when I need to wake up and adjust to the time-difference. No side-effects at all, just energy.
title: Recommended for international travel!

body: I don't tend to buy things like this.  I have always relied on caffeine in coffee or soda when I was running low on energy.  As a chick, these darn hormones can leave you feeling like a wiped out zombie.  I bought this first when I was on my way from Seattle to Pullman to visit my daughter in college and was getting pretty hormonally sleepy halfway there.  Not like there are napping spots in desert farmland.  It worked great without giving you the jitters or making you have to pee every 5 minutes.  I have always kept them in my car since then.  Lately at work, I have found just a half bottle of these little beauties has really helped my energy and motivation as I have a very physically demanding job that doesn't respect a woman's hormones.  Has been a life saver.  Most flavors are pretty nasty, but this new Peach Mango is actually tolerable.  I'd recommend this to any and every hormonal woman out there.  Cheers!!
title: Love this stuff!!!

body: I don't like coffee, but have tried caffeine pills before, but this stuff is much better, and works quicker. The taste can be kinda bitter (I usually get grape, but have also tried orange and lemon when that was all the store had available), so I always chug it down in one gulp, and then either drink some other kind of flavored juice or chew gum to get rid of the taste. I only use it for general alertness, never as a substitute for sleep, to try to stay up late for whatever reason. It's mostly just to ward off that "blah" feeling that sometimes hits in the afternoon, so I'll drink a bottle sometime between 12-2pm. But never after 2pm, because I want to make sure that it's completely worn off by the evening, so it doesn't effect my sleep-cycle. Sometimes I'll drink one bottle first thing in the morning when I wake up. But then I make sure at least 5 hours have passed before taking another one that same day. Taken effectively, it works perfectly. TWO THUMBS UP!
title: THIS STUFF WORKS!

body: I work a desk job and my place of work typically gets a little slow and quiet in the afternoons.  There are afternoons when I find myself slowly losing concentration and, on rare occasions, find my eyelids drooping a bit.  Those are the days I use 5 Hour Energy.  I have heard some say they don't like the taste, but I have tried several flavors and haven't found any I don't like (though I DO wish there were a double fudge brownie flavor).  The energy boost is quick and noticeable, and I have yet to experience any sort of crash.
title: Great for a quick boost

body: My son used this drink when he was driving us for a round trip of a little better than 725 miles and had no problem getting drowsy. Also, have tried it for meetings where I need to be "awake & alert" - worked there, too.  Recommend it but the cost is a little high, I think, but probably worth it.

body: I'm not an avid energy drink taker.  In fact, I find a lot of the other drinks that claim to give you energy poor excuses for foul tasting beverages.  Red Bull and Monster, to me, taste horrible and on top of that do very little for me when it comes to the energy departments.  So, after a grueling night with the baby, a newborn, I saw one of these at the local gas station and decided to give it a try.  I will say, while not a homerun when it comes to taste, it wasnt bad.  That could be, though, because there isnt that much liquid to swallow, so the taste is a one time deal unlike with larger energy drinks.  The grape was not horrible.  Nor my preferred drink taste, but tolerable.  I will say this, their advertisements were pretty dead on.  It provided me an alert feeling with little to no jitters.  I was more awake and felt better suited for the day than I would have felt had I not taken the shot.  Also, I didnt feel a big crash when it wore off, more like a cooling of my body.  I will say this, I do not take one of these every day.  It is about a once every week or two thing for me, depending on how the baby slept. So, that is probably why it worked so well for me.  As with anything, if you take too much of it, your body will get used to it, and it will have a different effect. Also, I am not a huge soda drinker, so caffeine in any form will usually give me a jolt, but unlike with soft drinks or other caffeinated beverages, this lasted a good while and didnt spike me in any direction.  Highly recommend.
title: Works Great For Me

body: I am very careful not to overload.  I take one bottle per day.  1/2 in the morning and the other 1/2 around 3 pm. Keeps be going with out the caffeine jitters. I have taken them for about 1 year and feel they are very safe if one does not take more than on per day.
title: Can't love with out them!!!

body: I've been getting the original orange flavor, which I think is great (so much so I went looking for a caffeine-free drink that was similar) but apparently I'm the only one that liked the "bite" or zest this flavor had. This new "improved" flavor is horrible, in my opinion. Lacks that "bite" from the original and tastes like orange cough syrup or those old cheap icy-pops. Overly sweet orange flavor with a slight after taste that for some reason reminds me of my grandmother's old indoor planter's dirt... I don't know if that is the taste or subtle smell, but if taming down the intensity of the flavor was the goal - goal accomplished, but I'm not so sure I'll continue buying it. Not a fan of the berry either, so I may have to find another brand all together. Then again, if you liked orange icy-pops as a kid, then this will probably bring back fond memories.
title: original orange flavor was great - "New and Improved" orange flavor is a warmed over icy-pop

body: I had to stop drinking carbonated beverages about 10 years ago and I hated taking caffeine in tablet form, it was all to hard on my stomach, esophagus and blood pressure.  So I broke down and tried this during a long car trip and much to my joy it was wonderful.  The vitamin B(s) that are added make it a smooth up and a smooth down, not a jolt yet it does far more than just caffeine would and lasts longer.  I don't use it daily, but when I have to be somewhere and I am feeling sluggish I just drink this and very soon the cob webs have disappeared, my sight has cleared and I am ready to deal with what I have to do.  I also have a lot of sleep issues and I can use this to stabilize my sleep pattern as well.  I also enjoy mixing it with juice instead of drinking it straight, but the taste isn't bad by itself and best of all it doesn't hurt my stomach or esophagus.
title: Healthier than caffeine by soda pop or Coffee and much easier on your body!

body: Yes, it is a pick-me-up shot. Yes it has caffeine. But the way this energy drink is formulated, there's enough caffeine to simulate a cup of coffee intake, but somehow they have put it all together to completely avoid the crash afterwards. You have to appreciate that. In fact it makes you feel like you've had eight hours of sleep. It's impressive actually. No matter what the taste. Yes, the taste is slightly better than it was. But hey, coffee has that hard licorice taste and beet ain't much better. And those are some pretty big addictive habits we manage to work around the taste no, so why not soldier on through the taste of 5-hour? Just saying.
title: Five-Hour, All The Rested Feeling, Non of the Crashed Feeling

body: Nothing wrong with product, it does what it's supposed to and is at a good price on Amazon. After experiencing some odd symptoms I will use the extra strength once in awhile, if at all.  Would not recommend using it everyday as I developed shortness of breath type symptoms when used everyday for 2 weeks.  I felt normal again about a week later after discontinuing use.  I also used one bottle before doing an interval workout and nearly had a heart attack. Since then I've tried the regular versions and have not experienced the same type of symptoms as the extra strength, perhaps the extra strength is just more than my body needs.  Like any supplement have some common sense while using it.
title: Gives You Energy, Just Not For Me

body: I am in nursing school so my sleep is cut in half during the school year. I had several issues with my stomach and shakiness with coffee and although awake, I still felt super tired. Additionally, tea was not cutting it. I only take half a 5-hour Energy in the morning and maybe later in the day of I need it; on long days I split it into three and take it throughout the day. It does not make me feel shaky, I don't experience palpitations, and best of all I feel awake and not tired. I don't recommend taking the whole bottle at once unless you really need. Otherwise, great product!
title: My go-to solution to combat sleepy eyes!

body: I don't tend to buy things like this.  I have always relied on caffeine in coffee or soda when I was running low on energy.  As a chick, these darn hormones can leave you feeling like a wiped out zombie.  I bought this first when I was on my way from Seattle to Pullman to visit my daughter in college and was getting pretty hormonally sleepy halfway there.  Not like there are napping spots in desert farmland.  It worked great without giving you the jitters or making you have to pee every 5 minutes.  I have always kept them in my car since then.  Lately at work, I have found just a half bottle of these little beauties has really helped my energy and motivation as I have a very physically demanding job that doesn't respect a woman's hormones.  Has been a life saver.  Most flavors are pretty nasty, but this new Peach Mango is actually tolerable.  I'd recommend this to any and every hormonal woman out there.  Cheers!!

body: This product is great and you get what the ads tell you about this product. You can definitely get through hours where you are extremely tired. Usually take it either in the afternoon to get through the rest of the day; small sip before a workout, half a bottle around 10PM when going out during the weekend. This product has a bit of an intense flavor - overall all of them do, so have some water ready as a chaser. This product will get you to a state like when you slept 10 hours and are bright awake and alert, however you wont have the jitters, shaky hands or anything like it. After the 5-6 hours it slowly fades away and you literally get back to the state you were at before taking this product - so there is no crash or anything. Aside from that your body will just extract this product after a bathroom run - it is not based on caffeine or taurine it actually works based on insane amounts of Vitamin B6 and B12 - one of them is at 8000% of your DV for food intake. Personally I have had great experience with it; though I have heard from people that they end up having to visit the bathroom due to some digestive issues.

body: I must note that I am mildly sensitive to caffeine and usually very reserved on using energy drinks. This has been one of those rare products that delivers as advertised. I would rate this product toward what I use it for. I have always had difficulty getting up in the morning, no matter how long I sleep. I have heard of people using this as a replacement for their morning coffee and thought I should give it a try. Being that I am sensitive to caffeine  I tried only half a bottle the first morning and I have to say that within 5 minutes I felt what I would call a "natural" burst of energy. By "natural" I mean that I do not get the nasty jittery energy most competing products give you. For those who are sensitive to caffeine can relate to the slightly anxious and nausea inducing feeling most energy drinks give you,  this DOES NOT do that. Highly recommend this product for morning use, no crash at all. I would give this a perfect 5 if it wasn’t so darn expensive.
title: Great Product to get the gears running in the morning!

body: These little "drinks" are really the perfect energy boost. Like their commercials, I take these when I get that blah feeling at work after lunch. The taste is so tart and sour (which is great because I love sour things!) that I feel like it gives me an instant jolt just because the taste wakes you up a bit. Then minutes later I feel like I'm getting my second wind for the day. I don't take these daily, only when I'm literally debating taking a nap instead. Definitely a much better choice than any of the cans of energy drinks that make you jittery, bloated, and then crash. NO crash with these. They're great!

body: I am very sensitive to caffeine and apparently, also to B vitamins.  I basically cant have coffee, soda, or even a chocolate bar after 3pm or I wont sleep at night.  I use these before I go to the gym around noon, but at that point I already have 2 cups of coffee in me and if I have anymore caffeine then I'm going to get a case of the shakes and the poops, and nobody needs that.  So I drink one of these right before the gym and I can feel the energy hitting me 10-20 minutes later.  And oh man does this stuff make me sweat!  I mean I can run on the treadmill for a mile and work up a decent sweat, like 20% of my shirt is soaked in sweat; but when I take the decaf 5 hour energy 75% of my shirt is drenched.  But its worth it because it gives me the energy kick that I need for an awesome workout.

body: As I have become older in age, I felt it became difficult to wake up energized and refreshed with just 5 or 6 hours of sleep. I rarely drank coffee before my 40's. When I say rare, I mean once or none a year. About a year ago, I tried coffee regularly in the mornings, however, it really did not give me a wake up boost, or if it did, it the feeling of alertness and energy lasted 30 minutes or so. Plus, coffee made me want to urinate due to the caffeine and volume of liquid intake. Also it stains the teeth. Therefore I decided to try the 5 hour energy. From day 1, it gave me the boost that I needed in the mornings. And it last for several hours, maybe not exactly 5, but the effects are longer lasting than coffee. It's simple to prepare. Just twist the cap off even with the wrapper in place and drink either the whole bottle or half. It's that quick. No boiling water, coffee filters, or waiting for the coffee to cool down.  Half a bottle is enough for me in the early morning, then I save the rest for later during the day. The 5 hour energy also doubles as  my pre-energy workout drink. It gives me the power boost I need to power through  my workouts even with 5 or less hours of sleep.
title: Better and cheaper than coffee

body: The product arrived very quickly and the price was great. I would reorder this in a heartbeat. My middle of the road rating is based on the efficacy of this product. I presume product quality and consistency, but when it's combined with me does it have a predictable, reliable, and consistent effect? In my experience, wanting to skip that late afternoon slump, sometimes this helped, sometimes it didn't. I've also tried the caffeine tablets which may also do the job on a hit and miss basis but those tablets leave me feeling jittery; this product hasn't done that. The caffeine tablets are a whole lot less expensive per dose, but I suspect not as healthy in the long run. If you feel that 4PM (or 4AM for you graveyard shift workers) slump coming on, this may help you over it and without any after effects in my experience. Because it doesn't always do that I wouldn't use either of the products I've mentioned to squeeze out another 100 miles on the road when I had already had a full day. I suppose it doesn't hurt to keep a bottle in the glove compartment and take it pro-actively, but if you're already tired get off the road, please. The manufacturer has no warning and maybe none is needed, but I have this gut feeling this product shouldn't be exposed to excessive heat, like might happen in the parked car in some climates. My gut feeling is that the product could be diminished, but some additives in diet sodas, for instance, can change chemically under heat, so better safe than sorry; store smartly.
title: Mixed Review means it might be wonderful, or it might not perform as expected and it all depends ON YOU!

body: I'll be honest, I was a total skeptic of 5-hour energy for a LONG time. The TV ads seemed like a scam, no one I knew had tried them, and I just didn't buy into their marketing. Sure enough, I was browsing Amazon late at night one evening and decided to just try a box out. Why not, right? All I can say, is that these are unreal. Straight up. I don't know what else to say. I'm actually still trying to figure out how these are legal and the boost is amazing. Everything they claim is fact. There are not jittery feelings, no crash. The only thing they don't tell you is that the boost is so great that you'll want them all the time and they aren't cheap.

But still, it's better than anything else I've tried. But the taste of 5-hour is, uh, shall we say, less than desirable? That is, until this new lemonade flavor, which is great! body: I must note that I am mildly sensitive to caffeine and usually very reserved on using energy drinks. This has been one of those rare products that delivers as advertised. I would rate this product toward what I use it for. I have always had difficulty getting up in the morning, no matter how long I sleep. I have heard of people using this as a replacement for their morning coffee and thought I should give it a try. Being that I am sensitive to caffeine  I tried only half a bottle the first morning and I have to say that within 5 minutes I felt what I would call a "natural" burst of energy. By "natural" I mean that I do not get the nasty jittery energy most competing products give you. For those who are sensitive to caffeine can relate to the slightly anxious and nausea inducing feeling most energy drinks give you,  this DOES NOT do that. Highly recommend this product for morning use, no crash at all. I would give this a perfect 5 if it wasn’t so darn expensive.
title: Great Product to get the gears running in the morning!

body: I love these things. 5 Hour Energy has been my energy supplement of choice for several years now. Although they all taste a little odd, pomegranate is my favorite flavor. If you really don't like the taste, combining with a soft drink or even just a bottle of water will mask things well. Functionally, they are wonderful. I notice less usefulness when taken in the morning, but a great boost for those nights that you know you will need to be awake until 1 or 2...as long as you remember to take one 4 or 5 hours earlier! As usual, Amazon prices beat convenience stores, so I keep a few stashed away (laptop bag, car, work) so they are around when I need them!

body: I've tried several energy products, both drinks and pills, and 5-hour energy is my favorite.  It certainly gives me a kick of energy but doesn't leave me jittery or anxious at all. It is convienent to use and take with me.  I usually keep me with me, one at home, and one in the office in case I hit a mid-day slump. I don't recommend it for any type of weight loss product but if you take it before you hit the gym, you'll get a boost for your workout. I can't take it after about 3:00pm though or I can't sleep at night (around 10pm). I like the pomegranate flavor, but can't stand the Berry flavor.

body: If you go anywhere else to buy these single at a time, they will often over charge. body: Pomegranate is the best tasting out of the Five-Hour Energy drinks.  I have been drinking these for quite some time now.  I only consume approx. half of a bottle and save the rest for later.  I enjoy consuming these during work or before an early morning workout when I may need that extra boost.  No GI side effects, no jitters, no headache.  I have not experienced not one adverse side effect.  The bottle states  that it is equivalent to one cup of coffee, but one cup of coffee would not produce the same amount of clear, pure energy that this drink provides. I don't drink them that often at all, just when I really am starting to fall asleep. These are so much cheaper than in stores and I have had no issues with quality. They come in the same boxes like are displayed in most stores. I love the pink lemonade ones out of all of them. They are still tart, but are a lot easier to drink compared to others.
title: It actually works! No longer tired and no jittery feeling!

body: I consistently only get 4.5 hours of energy off of these (I've timed it). And they taste like donkey butt, unless you like the taste of fake sugars, in which case you'll love these. But I trust my life to them when I'm driving and need a wake-me-up. The first time I tried one, both my wife and I were ready to fall asleep but we wanted to get to our destination. I chugged one of these, suppressed the urge to barf, and kept driving. About an hour later, I realized that, while I was still tired, I wasn't fall-asleep-at-the-wheel tired anymore. And after we got to our destination - about 4 hours later, I didn't crash, but instead slid gently back down to being tired.

body: I've been getting the original orange flavor, which I think is great (so much so I went looking for a caffeine-free drink that was similar) but apparently I'm the only one that liked the "bite" or zest this flavor had. This new "improved" flavor is horrible, in my opinion. Lacks that "bite" from the original and tastes like orange cough syrup or those old cheap icy-pops. Overly sweet orange flavor with a slight after taste that for some reason reminds me of my grandmother's old indoor planter's dirt... I don't know if that is the taste or subtle smell, but if taming down the intensity of the flavor was the goal - goal accomplished, but I'm not so sure I'll continue buying it. Not a fan of the berry either, so I may have to find another brand all together. Then again, if you liked orange icy-pops as a kid, then this will probably bring back fond memories.

body: 5 Hour Energy Decaf is a great pick-me-up for 5-7 hours on days when I just need a an extra boost. I use 5 Hour Energy Decaf when I'm going to be driving a long distance or when I'm just needing an evening boost after several hours of physical or mental work. The taste is definitely quite citrusy, but tolerable. I'm not drinking it as a liquid treat, so that's not an issue at all, especially since there's only a swallow-and-a-half to gulp down. I'm an active male (play tennis 2-3 times weekly--singles and doubles), age 64, weight 160, height 5'8". I've tried the caffeinated version and don't appreciate the "bladder effect."

body: My son used this drink when he was driving us for a round trip of a little better than 725 miles and had no problem getting drowsy. Since I start yawning about time I leave the drive way, I decided to try it when we recently drove 750 miles in 2 days.  It worked-I don't think I yawned a single time while driving.  Also, have tried it for meetings where I need to be "awake & alert" - worked there, too.  Recommend it but the cost is a little high, I think, but probably worth it.

body: I love these things. 5 Hour Energy has been my energy supplement of choice for several years now. Although they all taste a little odd, pomegranate is my favorite flavor. If you really don't like the taste, combining with a soft drink or even just a bottle of water will mask things well. Functionally, they are wonderful. I notice less usefulness when taken in the morning, but a great boost for those nights that you know you will need to be awake until 1 or 2...as long as you remember to take one 4 or 5 hours earlier! As usual, Amazon prices beat convenience stores, so I keep a few stashed away (laptop bag, car, work) so they are around when I need them!
title: They'll keep you going. and going. and going.

body: Nothing wrong with product, it does what it's supposed to and is at a good price on Amazon. After experiencing some odd symptoms I will use the extra strength once in awhile, if at all.  Would not recommend using it everyday as I developed shortness of breath type symptoms when used everyday for 2 weeks.  I felt normal again about a week later after discontinuing use.  I also used one bottle before doing an interval workout and nearly had a heart attack. Since then I've tried the regular versions and have not experienced the same type of symptoms as the extra strength, perhaps the extra strength is just more than my body needs.  Like any supplement have some common sense while using it.
title: Gives You Energy, Just Not For Me

body: Works as expected!
title: Good Product

body: Need a boost? I've come to rely on this stuff! I have a job that keeps me up late working on the computer. I often need a little something to help me stay awake. This does it without any negative side affects for me. Sometimes I only have a third or half bottle, and that's enough. I even can sleep when I finally make it to bed.  My other "go to" solution to stay awake is something my dad taught me years ago. He used to do this while driving on the highway late at night - Eat sunflower seeds in the shell. The act of separating the seed from the shell is enough activity to keep one awake. Try doing it with just your tongue, then spit the shell out. You're welcome.
title: My booster extraordinaire.

But the way this energy drink is formulated, there's enough caffeine to simulate a cup of coffee intake, but somehow they have put it all together to completely avoid the crash afterwards. You have to appreciate that. In fact it makes you feel like you've had eight hours of sleep. It's impressive actually. No matter what the taste. Yes, the taste is slightly better than it was. But hey, coffee has that hard licorice taste and beet ain't much better. And those are some pretty big addictive habits we manage to work around the taste no, so why not soldier on through the taste of 5-hour? Just saying.

body: Like most of the reviews posted here, I give this product a positive rating. For me, it does what it claims to do... and I especially appreciate the "no crash" effect after a few hours! I first found out about this product when I started racing Go-Karts this year... I hit the local Stop-N-Shop before getting to the track and decided to plunk out the $3.00, as I was a bit tired. I threw it in my cooler and then drank it just prior to my qualifying session. Almost immediately, I could feel the "boost"... and it helped out on track! I never felt the Niacin rush that some claim, but the one thing I did notice, was that my jaw was a bit tight due to the jolt of energy. I only have few suggestions: I've tried all the flavors, and I think the Orange flavor is the best; I drink the product chilled... tastes better to me that way; the flavor is a bit too sweet for me so I add it into my personal water bottle; I buy this on amazon because it's a lot cheaper than buying it at my local Stop-N-Shop!
title: Professional Driver On A Closed Course! :-)

body: This product is great and you get what the ads tell you about this product. You can definitely get through hours where you are extremely tired. Usually take it either in the afternoon to get through the rest of the day; small sip before a workout, half a bottle around 10PM when going out during the weekend. This product has a bit of an intense flavor - overall all of them do, so have some water ready as a chaser. This product will get you to a state like when you slept 10 hours and are bright awake and alert, however you wont have the jitters, shaky hands or anything like it. After the 5-6 hours it slowly fades away and you literally get back to the state you were at before taking this product - so there is no crash or anything. Aside from that your body will just extract this product after a bathroom run - it is not based on caffeine or taurine it actually works based on insane amounts of Vitamin B6 and B12 - one of them is at 8000% of your DV for food intake. Personally I have had great experience with it; though I have heard from people that they end up having to visit the bathroom due to some digestive issues.
title: Works as the ads say it does...

body: As someone who dislikes coffee and sometimes needs more caffeine than tea (and sometimes you dont want a whole cup of something) energy shots present a great option for me. 5 hour does a good job of reassuring us that it's safe. My independent googling confirms that claim. This is also by far my favorite flavor. This is like happy juice for me. Highly recommended.
title: Happy juice

body: I wanted to try this product to see what all the buzz was about with the "5 Hour Energy" drinks.  Seemed like everyone is using them.  I had trouble finding them in local stores, so I ordered this box from Amazon.  The price was good and there were no problems with the shipping.  There is only enough caffeine equivalent to one cup of coffee in each bottle.  I'm a huge coffee drinker, so this product did not work for me.  I did not feel any more energy when I needed it and it did not keep me awake or alert.  In fact, I got stomach cramps and diarrhea for several days after using this product.  I'm physically fit and do the P90X workouts. I eat healthy food and rarely have abnormal bowel movements or diarrhea.  As a test, I did not use this product for a week and felt fine with normal bowel movements.  I then used another 5 Hour Drink and the next day, diarrhea again!  It may work for other people, but it did not work for me!
title: Not for Me!

body: I can honestly say that these shots are sometimes crutches for me when I feel like I'm about to just pass out. I'm majoring in Mechanical Engineering and these things are PHENOMENAL for when you need to get some late night studying done, or if you need some energy to focus on exams. It takes about ~20 minutes for me to feel the effects, and it lasts for 3-4 hours for me. I feel only slightly jittery, but there's a significant difference in the amount of focus you get from a 5 hour energy than your regular energy drink. I suppose the B vitamins are to thank for that! And of course, the best part... NO CRASH! I highly recommend these if you are a college student. They are VERY beneficial and will give you that extra boost and focus you need!
title: A college student's best friend!

body: As a morning person, afternoons are usually not a creatively productive time for me.  I found that when I try to keep going by drinking coffee I sometimes experience drowsiness as though the caffeine has an opposite effect on me.  I tried a few of the different energy drinks and found that 5-Hour works best for me.  The taste is OK, but I'm not drinking it for the taste.  I also like the fact that you don't have to drink a 16 Oz can of fluid.  I don't use it every day but when I need to work into the evening, it keeps me alert, energized, and productive.  There is no after-effect that I can tell.  I fall asleep quickly and get a good night's rest after 5-6 hours.  Results may vary for different people, but this works for me.  The price is a bit steep but you can find pretty good deals if you shop around and buy in bulk.

body: The product arrived very quickly and the price was great. I would reorder this in a heartbeat. My middle of the road rating is based on the efficacy of this product. I presume product quality and consistency, but when it's combined with me does it have a predictable, reliable, and consistent effect? In my experience, wanting to skip that late afternoon slump, sometimes this helped, sometimes it didn't. I've also tried the caffeine tablets which may also do the job on a hit and miss basis but those tablets leave me feeling jittery; this product hasn't done that. The caffeine tablets are a whole lot less expensive per dose, but I suspect not as healthy in the long run. If you feel that 4PM (or 4AM for you graveyard shift workers) slump coming on, this may help you over it and without any after effects in my experience. Because it doesn't always do that I wouldn't use either of the products I've mentioned to squeeze out another 100 miles on the road when I had already had a full day. I suppose it doesn't hurt to keep a bottle in the glove compartment and take it pro-actively, but if you're already tired get off the road, please. The manufacturer has no warning and maybe none is needed, but I have this gut feeling this product shouldn't be exposed to excessive heat, like might happen in the parked car in some climates. My gut feeling is that the product could be diminished, but some additives in diet sodas, for instance, can change chemically under heat, so better safe than sorry; store smartly.
title: Mixed Review means it might be wonderful, or it might not perform as expected and it all depends ON YOU!

body: As a caffeine sensitive person, I thought I would never find an energy drink that would be helpful without having really unpleasant side-effects. In college, this is a huge problem! Well, not huge, but it is seriously inconvenient. Then I found 5-hour energy decaf and my world became a much more productive place. 5-hour energy decaf is really just a shot of B vitamins and has very little sugar. It tastes like slightly medicinal lemon aid, not intolerable at all. Does a nice job perking me up without making me feel edgy and shaky. Excellent stuff.
title: Great energy without the anxiety

body: This tastes great and is truly effective. I drank half a bottle every few hours everyday during finals week and was able to pound out those practice exams one after another--all day, baby! The best part is that there is no (sudden) crash like there would be after a sugar rush. The fatigue does catch up to you though, but not for a while and definitely not suddenly. I wouldn't advise drinking this first thing in the morning, though, like I did. Although you get a sudden jolt of energy, your stomach might be upset the rest of the day. It's best used to overcome that afternoon drowsiness, or to stay up late.

body: This is the go-to energy drink for this night owl on long road-trips. First, its compact size means that drinking isn't followed up by a couple of unwanted restroom stops. But most important, it really works, which is a mystery to me because the other energy drinks I tried didn't do much. 5 Hour Energy gives me a gentle but definite energy boost to keep driving alertly and safely. I usually sip about half the bottle, then follow up with more as I feel fatigued again. When it's finally time to sleep it doesn't keep me awake like caffeine would. The last time I stopped at a gas station to buy some the cashier said that it's the only one that works for him too, and he's tried them all. Don't know what they put in this stuff but it's great.
title: This is the go-to energy drink for this night owl on long road-trips.

body: As a morning person, afternoons are usually not a creatively productive time for me.  I found that when I try to keep going by drinking coffee I sometimes experience drowsiness as though the caffeine has an opposite effect on me.  I tried a few of the different energy drinks and found that 5-Hour works best for me.  The taste is OK, but I'm not drinking it for the taste.  I also like the fact that you don't have to drink a 16 Oz can of fluid.  I don't use it every day but when I need to work into the evening, it keeps me alert, energized, and productive.  There is no after-effect that I can tell.  I fall asleep quickly and get a good night's rest after 5-6 hours.  Results may vary for different people, but this works for me.  The price is a bit steep but you can find pretty good deals if you shop around and buy in bulk.
