body: I bought this item originally from a retailer here a few weeks ago and had to say that the product itself is a great one. Lots of energy not a crash and fairly sustained. The product that was sold to me however was not the same, and after noticing a few things being "off" about the packaging. I was curious about how using the product was going to go. I went ahead and tried one of these with no effect and then tried a second one a couple hours later hoping there would be at least something. After noticing nothing I decided to give it to a friend who works in a lab testing such and and had him test it with a store bought bottle and have him compare the two. The store bought one was verified to be as advertised, and my 12 pack bought off of amazon was in fact nothing more then colored water from nutritional stand point. I hate to say it but this a counterfeit, and would recommend amazon looks into stopping the selling of this particular product until another supplier can be found
title: I have now verified that this is in fact a fake

body: I don't like coffee. I don't like the taste, and I don't like the time you put into the ritual of brewing it and waiting for it to cool down enough to actually drink. So I stick to energy shots. I've tried pretty much every flavor of every brand on the market and I settled on 6 Hour Power frankly because it doesn't taste like cat piss. Every other one I've tried, including the ubiquitous 5 Hour Energy, are just plain nasty. 6 Hour Power, in all of its flavors (grape is my favorite, followed by orange and lemon/lime) just tastes better than the others.
title: Best tasting of all the energy shots

body: I've tried just about every Energy Drink/Shot on the market & Stacker 6-hr is BY FAR the best!! I actually drink these for medical reasons, to get a high-dose of vitamins my system lacks, so I really need the Energy. Stacker 6-hr Power supplements give me the most noticable increased energy level, no crash, & energy lasts a pretty long time. Stacker is difficult to find locally, almost everyone sells the 5-hr, but I think Stacker 6-hr blows away all the others. Some local gas stations do sell, but usually WAY TOO expensive. Some local Drugstores do sell & this price is pretty good if you're waiting on you're order. But, ordering online has proved to be the best way to get this product. SO...If you're looking for an energy boost - Vitamin Supp - lo-cal - check out stacker 6-hr power. Make sure you look around to find the best deal.
title: Awesom

body: UPDATE from original review below.  I have tihis on auto ship & was shocked to see it is now $6.00 more than the last time I ordered!  WHY? body: I do like the flavor but too sweet for me.Says it has the same amount of sugar as regular Red Bull but taste sweeter. Most of the sugar free gives me bad headaches plus they taste terrible. Don't understand why they have to put sooooo much sugar in. Just cut it back a bit and it would still be good. I know that caffeine is very bitter and needs to be offset with sugar but why 27 grams in just 8.4 oz. Basically the same as Coke. I can can only drink one every once in a while.
title: Too much sugar

body: While I tend to avoid sugary energy beverages, these have the right combination of flavor and 'kick' to let me slide past my own rule. I ordered the cranberry, but have tasted each of the flavors. I can say that the flavor is very good, though it still has that aftertaste that will not allow you to forget that it is still a redbull rather than a cranberry soda. The energy provided by the drink lasts a solid hour or so, but is still enough to help you gain momentum for your day.
title: Great Taste

body: I'll be honest, I was never a redbull fan.  I didn't hate, but strongly disliked the standard offering.  I saw this at a 7-11 a couple months ago and being a big cranberry fan, thought I'd give it a whirl.  Glad I did.  Tastes nothing like the sour smarties candy flavor that the standard redbull drink has.  Tastes pretty much like cranberry juice with the classic (albeit faint) energy drink brightness/zing.  To give a better understanding of my cranberry flavor profile, I also enjoy Sierra Mist Cranberry Splash.  I started buying the 4 packs, but they were a bit pricey.  Found this on Amazon and for about a $1.50, I'm sold.  Perfect for my caffeine fix at 6AM.
title: Red Bull Red Edition is the Truth

body: I hate the taste of regular Red Bull as well as every other energy drink I've ever tired, I find them way too sweet and acidic. This Red Edition (and it's siblings Blue & Silver)  however I love. They are not anywhere near as sweet or acidic but actually taste really very good.

body: I am one of those people who always needs extra energy / awareness. Coffee is not good choice because it give me crash later the day. I do not overdo it, one bottle is good for me for a few days (I used just little every time). The first day I drank half a bottle in the afternoon and I could not sleep all night. body: By far the best rush from any energy drink I've ever had. Normal energy drinks over the years have really lost their effect on me, and in turn I'd had to resort to drinking more and more to feel energized. The energy shots like 5hr, etc never gave me a rush, they just usually made me feel hot, flush and at times dizzy. These Redlines, though, perk me way up and do it within 10 minutes. For most you really shouldn't drink more than the half bottle that's recommended. Even on that half bottle I feel more energy and stay "up" longer than with anything else. I also don't feel a crash, as there's no sugar.
title: Best Energy Drink

body: This product has been one of the best 'energy drinks' i've had.  It doesn't make you crash like other products out there, and long lasting.  I am still not 100% sure about the '7.5% faster reaction time' but I did not buy the product for that 'feature' more on the energy aspect of it.  I specially like the fact that each bottle is two servings, so its 48 serving per purchase.  Compare that to 5hr energy drink which is approx. $2 per bottle and one serving which is approx. $96, if you take that route.

body: All I can say is wow! This stuff really is potent. If you workout, had a long night or just feel tired, pop a bottle and have half of it and you will no what I am talking about. Having said that, this is definitely NOT for everyone! If regular energy drinks (Red buu, Rockstar etc et) work for you then just have quarter of a bottle and see how you feel, it is VERY IMPORTANT you don't drink the entire bottle at once, this is no Redbull people! This is strong stuff so BE AWARE! It's a great pre workout drink as it really gives you the energy to get a great workout! Also time yourself so if you go to bed normal sleep hour I would not drink this after mid afternoon! It will guaranteed to keep you up!

I drink it now not so much for the caffeine but because I love the taste! It is sold in a variety of sizes but any can larger then the original 8.4oz can contains way too much caffeine for a single drink and it's average consumption time. body: Red bull gives you wings.  There is no better energy drink than Red Bull.  I have tried many different ones and only drink Red Bull.  It is a great alternative to coffee drinks, which can cost just as much at Starbucks.  It has many vitamins and caffeine to help you focus and that are good for your body at only 110 calories per can.  The 8.4 FL Oz size is perfect as drinking any more would likely cause problems.  Red Bull is also accidentally vegan which is great for getting vitamin B12, which is only naturally found in animal products.  Anyhow, how can you not love a company that sends a man to the edge of space for a supersonic freefall (Red Bull Stratos)?
title: Great for working out or studying

body: I am so addicted to Red Bull that I have one of the Amazon Dash buttons in my house that sends me this 24 pack anytime I push it. As I've read in some of the other reviews, Red Bull got super popular right as I was leaving HS and so, at the age when most people start drinking coffee, I started my mornings with Red Bull & in the same way people are cranky and half asleep before their AM coffee, I am the same way before I crack a can of this stuff and guzzle down some of that sweet sweet Bull.

body: I worked at a gas station when I was 18, about the time Red Bull started to become popular, at least in Missouri.  The sales representative came into the gas station while I will filling up on Mountain Dew.  He asked me if I was tired and I said yes.  He handed me my first Red Bull.
title: 12 years later Red Bull and I are still going strong.  That's longer than my marriage.  Just sayin.

body: Regular Red Bull is okay but not as good as this. This is possibly one of the best tasting energy drinks I have had. I have had many too since I worked at a convenience store for six years before college. Some are just plain nasty and taste like medicine or worse. The Red Bull Red Edition I could actually drink on a regular basis since it actually tastes delicious. It doesn't really taste like cranberry to me but is some kind of berry flavor. I recommend it for sure.
title: Delicious

body: Best tasting flavor of Red Bull by far! I absolutely love it but why the huge price increase I ordered a case of these from Amazon 2 weeks ago and it was $59.95 now it's $69.95 I can get them cheaper at my local Wal-Mart super center I would like to think the whole point in buying these in bulk would be to save a little bit of money. The Product itself is 5 Stars the new price makes it lose a star. I would love to continue buying case of this off Amazon but not at this price. Overall I would recommend this flavor to anyone it's my new favorite Red Bull even better than the Silver Lime Edition which was an amazing flavor and it looks to have been discontinued I still see it in some stores now and then. Hopefully they release it again. Anyways Taste/Flavor = 5 Stars, Can Design = 5 Stars Catches the eye without being too flashy, Price = 4 Stars Too High for buying a whole case now that the Yellow Edition is in almost every store it's not hard to get lower this back to $59.95 and you will have me buying these constantly.
title: Best tasting flavor of Red Bull by far

body: Finally, Amazon gives some good savings on Red Bull!  I admit that I drink this stuff way too frequently (at least a can a day).  My package came exactly as pictured with all cans accounted for.  I will reorder soon.... maybe today... :)

body: The folks in Austria have come up with a fine product. I gulp down a can of this sugarfree Red Bull every morning about an hour before I make my daily walk. It has made the walks much easier to complete and also increases the walking speed which in turn burns more calories with which I am glad to part. I happened to be over at Sam's club a while ago and they carry this product for 33 bucks and some change so I picked up a case while there. I live about 10 miles from Sam's so with gas prices ever climbing plus the state sales tax it would not be worth a trip just for the Red Bull. For only a couple bucks more Amazon will deliver a case right to my front door. Kinda pricey but the benefits to me are worth the cost.

body: So after searching high and low for the red bull zero product where I wouldn't spend an arm and a leg for it, I found it on amazon and with the subscribe and save feature it gets delivered right to my door monthly (yes I know I should drink that many energy drinks)!  I like the regular red bull, but didn't want all of the calories associated with it. I tried the sugar free version and hated it. So my next step was the zero. Although it doesn't have the same exact flavor as the regular red bull, I love it because it is zero carbs and zero sugar. I live in the Phoenix metro area and it is extremely hard to find this unless you buy them individually and I go through about 1 a day during the week. So with my other subscribe and save items I get monthly I save 15% on the original pricing. Way cheaper than buying them on sale at 2 for $5.
title: Value is great especially with the subscribe and save!

body: I began drinking energy drinks for the purpose of caffeine and tried many different ones. Most had high fructose corn syrup in them and contained way too much caffeine. I tried Red Bull and it was perfect! I actually love the taste! It's crisp and not overwhelmingly sweet or contain high fructose corn syrup. I drink it now not so much for the caffeine but because I love the taste! It is sold  in a variety of sizes but any can larger then the original 8.4oz can contains way too much caffeine for a single drink and it's average consumption  time. I do highly recommend Red Bull to anyone that is looking to buy an energy drink because of the reasons above along with my personal Tate preference in that it just tastes soooo good!
title: Best Flavor for Energy Drink

body: Can never go wrong with Red Bull.  I like the taste, and the slight thrust of energy. I thinly slice citrus fruits, small amount of organic vinegar and ice cold Red Bull together in a glass; its a great taste while preparing for work.  Red Bull never gives me the jitters, its the only energy drink I will buy.
title: Red Bull rules!

body: Ahh, Red Bull. Morning wake up drink, evening mixer with vodka. Whatever your choice, Red Bull will step up to the challenge. And yes my friend, you will love it. The 16oz cans make mere men tremble. It's double the normal intake, but you're not normal, are you? Of course not. Chug it down and face the world! This wonderful elixir is so powerful it will help you find true love, give you 6 pack abs, allow you to become a karate Black Belt in 3 days, talk to fish/small farm animals, AND put a moustache on a baby (no guarantee). So what are you waiting for? Get ya some of that.
title: Improved my love life!

body: Best price anywhere if you do it right! Having it delivered is an extra plus! When you use Amazons subscribe and save like I do, you get 15 percent off of all products ordered through the program. (Must have at least 5 items delivered on a basis such as monthly or every three months) This makes the red bull cheaper than costco, and you can pair it with everyday items such as toilet paper or toothpaste to get the price! This saves so much money and is the number 1 reason Inuse Amazon for my drink products. On another note, redbull is amazing and gives me so much energy. (No wings unfortunately)
title: Best price anywhere if you do it right

body: I don't like the taste of this as much as the regular one, but the regular Red Bull made me crash pretty hard when the sugar high would go away.  Since this has no sugar, it's less of an energy booster, but the sugar rush didn't last long to begin with.  If you're straight up exhausted, this won't do much, but very few legal things will.  I drink these when I'm about to take a test or need to study.  Personally, I can concentrate a lot better and I retain information better.  I'm not sure if it'll work for everyone, or if the effects I'm feeling are real (the whole placebo deal).  Anyways, it works for me, so I'm giving it the full five stars.
title: Works for me.

body: I love Red Bull, but the sugar content messes me up.  So the Sugarfree version is my go-to both for mixing and for drinking straight up for an energy boost.  Although some people complain that this gives them the jitters, I just feel more energetic.  Mixing with vodka gives a nice buzz but without the lethargy that comes with other non=energy drink mixes.
title: my go-to both for mixing and for drinking straight up for an energy boost

body: I've been downing cans of Sugarfree Red Bull for nearly a decade now and I look forward to one every morning. Unlike coffee and other energy drinks/shots it does not make me wired, instead they make me alert without any sort of crash. I'm usually a full-sugar kind of guy, but the Sugarfree version taste the best to me over their newer flavors and Zero (however, those are fun to sprinkle in now and then). The only thing awkward is the case size, in regards to Subscribe and Save, I cannot receive them more frequently than once a month, leaving me with about a week needed to supplement the shipped 24-pack. It's not a big deal, but it would be clever of Amazon to offer shipments every 24 days.
title: Delicious, stimulating nectar

Try one..and rate it for yourself..

body: We go through many cans of Red Bull a week in our house. My boyfriend works 2 jobs and he relies on Red Bull to help him get through his second job. I drink it to help get my day started because I am not a fan of coffee, but need some type of caffeine. I love that it has B Vitamins, gives me energy, and tastes great. I highly recommend Red Bull if you are looking for an energy drink. The only downfall to Red Bull (other than it not exactly being good for you) is the price, as it is more expensive than most energy drinks. This is not the case on here as I purchased the 12 pack of 16 oz Red Bull cans for just under $13; I can't even get the small cans for that price here! Unfortunately, Amazon prices always change so I probably will never get that price again.
title: Love Red Bull

body: The folks in Austria have come up with a fine product. I gulp down a can of this sugarfree Red Bull every morning about an hour before I make my daily walk. It has made the walks much easier to complete and also increases the walking speed which in turn burns more calories with which I am glad to part. I happened to be over at Sam's club a while ago and they carry this product for 33 bucks and some change so I picked up a case while there. I live about 10 miles from Sam's so with gas prices ever climbing plus the state sales tax it would not be worth a trip just for the Red Bull. For only a couple bucks more Amazon will deliver a case right to my front door. Kinda pricey but the benefits to me are worth the cost.

body: Some kind of caffeinated drink is an absolute requirement in my house...I drink coffee, but my husband is not a coffee man.  Red Bull is our drink of choice, because while it is a sugar bomb, it's a SUGAR bomb, rather than aspartame or sucralose (even non-diet Monster, Venom, and other energy drinks that I've seen use sucralose), both of which metabolize into nasty chemicals in your body (aspartame to a form of formaldehyde, sucralose to a chlorine compound--yummy!).  4 stars instead of 5 because at the price you pay to buy these just once, they're cheaper at the gas station. (If you subscribe, they're about 20 cents cheaper here.)

body: I no longer drink this or any Red Bull energy drink.  I switched back to coffee.  Plus did extensive research on the ingredients for this and regular Red Bull and the truth is some of the ingredients are harmful to your body.  The aspartame in the sugar free version is especially harmful.  Aspartame is a toxin that has so many bad side effects that it should be banned from any drink, period.  Red Bull sugar free is not the only drink you will find this in.  It is in a lot of soft drinks.  Since I stopped drinking it, I feel a whole lot better.  No wonder some countries have a ban on this drink.

body: My favorite energy drink. Tastes much better than regular red bull and as a bonus it doesn't have any sugar so it doesn't make you collapse two or three hours later (those who drink sugary energy drinks know what I am talking about). When I tasted it the first time I thought it was weird because I guess I was comparing it to the original, but after second or third I really started liking it. Now I can't drink the original kind. So if you think you don't like it the first time you try it, give it a chance. You might change your mind.
title: Best energy drink

body: How can you not love this?  It's Red Bull.  It gives me wings.  I would drink this all the time if I could.  I have been known to chase around the Red Bull truck in town hoping he'd crash and Red Bull would spill out on the road (I carry a straw).  LOVE.
title: Who wouldn't love this?

body: Ordered this case of red bull for my trip to Vegas so we could have a walking mixer for the town. Didn't disappoint whatsoever. So much lighter than original red bull and doesn't have that syrupy taste like the original. Made the trip a blast. Highly recommend for those that want the kick of RB but don't like the heavy taste or calorie load of RB original.

body: I am not a fan of coffee,  and this gives me just the boost I need in the morning. Yes, I looked up all the ingredients. Yes I know people say energy drinks are bad for you, NO, I don't know why (other than most carbonated beverages aren't great for you).
title: Be a Rockstar every day.

body: You can't beat RockStar Orange for a quick 'energy pick-up'. I used to drink the regular version but found that I could not drink it on an empty stomach. Plus I noticed that I was rather fizzy.  This is not the case with the Orange flavor version.  It is not a fizzy drink, very easy on a sensitive stomach, and a great flavor too!
title: This is now my go-to flavor of Rockstar. I also feel the Orange flavor has the edge over the lemon version too!

body: These are my favorite energy drinks. I only drink one per night on nights I work to give me the energy I need to make it through a 12 hr shift, but I think they are also a reason I don't sleep well when I am working. When I do 4 nights in a row I am so exhausted from 4 twelve hour shifts and no sleep that it takes me a long time to recover. These have one thing going for them and that is they have filtered water instead of carbonated water. I also like the taste and they do give the energy I need short term. If you feel you have to drink an energy drink, I think this one is the best. However, I am going to try to get off of them because of the artificial sugar contained in them. I am looking at more healthy alternatives to energy drinks in general.
title: The best energy drink out there, if you have to have an energy drink.

body: At the $32 price point, I can't really beat that unless I find the extremely rare 10 for 10 sale at grocery store. I need my caffeine fix but can't drink coffee. Rockstar orange isn't my first choice for energy drinks, but for the price, I'll definitely be happy with it.

body: I am not a fan of coffee,  and this gives me just the boost I need in the morning. Yes, I looked up all the ingredients. Yes I know people say energy drinks are bad for you, NO, I don't know why (other than most carbonated beverages aren't great for you).
title: Be a Rockstar every day.

body: You can't beat RockStar Orange for a quick 'energy pick-up'. I used to drink the regular version but found that I could not drink it on an empty stomach. Plus I noticed that I was rather fizzy.  This is not the case with the Orange flavor version.  It is not a fizzy drink, very easy on a sensitive stomach, and a great flavor too!
title: This is now my go-to flavor of Rockstar. I also feel the Orange flavor has the edge over the lemon version too!

body: These are my favorite energy drinks. I only drink one per night on nights I work to give me the energy I need to make it through a 12 hr shift, but I think they are also a reason I don't sleep well when I am working. When I do 4 nights in a row I am so exhausted from 4 twelve hour shifts and no sleep that it takes me a long time to recover. These have one thing going for them and that is they have filtered water instead of carbonated water. I also like the taste and they do give the energy I need short term. If you feel you have to drink an energy drink, I think this one is the best. However, I am going to try to get off of them because of the artificial sugar contained in them. I am looking at more healthy alternatives to energy drinks in general.
title: The best energy drink out there, if you have to have an energy drink.

body: At the $32 price point, I can't really beat that unless I find the extremely rare 10 for 10 sale at grocery store. I need my caffeine fix but can't drink coffee. Rockstar orange isn't my first choice for energy drinks, but for the price, I'll definitely be happy with it.
title: Mmmm ...  Caffeine

body: I love this flavor from Rockstar. It is almost impossible to find any locally so I was thrilled to find this in bulk online. You can also get a monthly subscription so you never run out! Amazon beats any price I found online especially with their shipping costs. Would recommend to anyone who doesn't like the typical energy drink flavor.
title: I love this flavor from Rockstar

body: The are my favorites. The flavor reminds me of HI-C orange. There is no carbonation so that's probably my favorite parts. Also, it doesn't give me a huge jolt of energy, just a little kick in the pants. They are actually very refreshing, more like a sports drink than an energy drink. Thank goodness I can get them here, as they are difficult to find in stores.

body: I literally live on these underway in the Navy. I am so horribly addicted to caffeine+whatever else Monster sticks in these things that I literally have withdrawal symptoms if I don't have 3-4 in a day. At the time I bought this, it was a 24 pack for 31 bucks, free shipping, free tax. I should have gotten more than two. Blue is literally the best flavor. Green tastes like some nasty apple jolly rancher and red bull had a baby; white tastes like expired sprite. My ship's store doesn't stock or sell anything other than green or white, so to have blue during underways I need to buy it before we sail.
title: 4/5 US Sailors I know who drink Monsters think Blue is the best flavor... 3/4 if you discount me.

body: I didn't realize these were mini cans. But since I had a coupon they came out to be a tad bit cheaper than buying them at my favorite gas station (assuming they would ever carry them and sold them half price). These mini cans help a lot when I'm at work. I don't have to worry about taking a half empty can home and drink the rest the next night. They also help me watch how much caffeine I drink each night at work. If these were available again, and hopefully I'll be able to see other flavors, I'd keep buying them. They have already saved me money in the past couple of weeks because I already have twelve cans waiting for me to drink them, versus buying them last minute at a more expensive price at certain gas stations when I've forgotten multiple times before my work week begins.
title: Mini cans!

body: I love the product, it taste great, but my mother showed me an article on how monster can give you heart attacks more likely. I had 1 monster when I ordered it and my blood pressure was high and I was so excited and pumped. I couldn't sleep for 30 hours. I wanted to return it but they don't accept returns. I was so astonished and glad that I didn't have to do any work. Don't drink too much guys you can have a heart attack or die much faster. Now I have 23 monster cans and it's sad to say Im going to throw it away because I don't wanna give it away to take someone's life away. 1 monster is about 12 cups of coffee or 23 can of coca cola. I had 1 monster when I ordered it and my blood pressure was high and I was so excited and pumped. I couldn't sleep for 30 hours. I wanted to return it but they don't accept returns. I was so astonished and glad that I didn't have to do any work. Don't drink too much guys you can have a heart attack or die much faster. Now I have 23 monster cans and it's sad to say Im going to throw it away because I don't wanna give it away to take someone's life away. 1 monster is about 12 cups of coffee or 23 can of coca cola. It has over 60 grams of sugar. Great product , just don't drink to much. enjoy

body: Best I can say is i was SURPRISED.  I drink monster zero everyday. When I see a new flavor I get one. Usually I rotate around all the zero flavors...i like the all so far. I saw this one on amazon, I hadn't seen it in the store so I bought a case. My first impression....EWE!!! The can is dark blue and the drink is yellow I was expecting some sort of Berry or fruit flavor. IT IS NOT. It's only a hint of fruit flavor. Mostly energy drink flavor with carbonated soda flavor. Hard to describe. If I could I would probably return them but I would imagine the shipping would be crazy expensive. Besides I can hardly lift the case. Had to have help. This one will for sure NOT be one I'll buy again. The last new one I tried was the zero black-cherry flavor (the best yet). Sorry monster this one missed the mark..for me anyway. And I drink one every day. BUYER BEWARE!!!
title: EWE YUCK

Rest assured, if you buy these (and therefore get them shipped) via Amazon and not a random seller, the price will almost always be below 30 bucks, and the packaging will be heavy duty to prevent any damage, not to mention that you get the prime option. body: This Company is terrible.  I am in Afghanistan and could not help a friend move, so I figured Monsters were the next best thing.  I spent more in shipping than the product cost to get it there in time.  The Company was slow to ship and the delivery was late dispite the faster shipping.  I tried to cancel the order when I found out that they had not bothered to ship it in a timly maner, they told me they would redirect it back and then delivered it to an empty apartment anyway.

body: These are awesome and I love buying in bulk. MY boyfriend has one before work everyday because he works third shift but has classes during the day. I found it cheaper to do this so I bought a couple 24 packs. These did not last long between the two of us. They taste wonderful but are a lot of caffeine. If you don't drink it normally Id NOT suggest these! My friend tried one and could not finish it. She felt sick the entire rest of the day because she never drinks caffeine. I routinely drink it and have since I was young. These cans are wonderful for me to take in my lunch to college classes and help me keep up between class, clinical, working and homework! Plus 20 calories for a whole can? Who can beat that?

body: I have been buying this product since January 2017.  In the last 2 months of buying this product, The price has fluctuated quite significantly from 24.26 to 25.41, 26.08 and then a whopping jump to $41.63!!  I was ready to just click and forget it but I saw the price flash on my screen right before it told me my order was complete and I was able to cancel the order before any payments were actually paid.  Now the price is back down to $27.48.  The 20 pack satisfies my boyfriend's Monster obsession quite nicely without having him go to Irving every day but with the price fluctuating so much I might have to stick to BJ's Wholesale Club and find manufacturers coupons to use instead.  I hope you guys get your act together and keep a steady price of a product because I am about to stop buying it here altogether.
title: The 20 pack satisfies my boyfriend's Monster obsession quite nicely without having him go to Irving every day but ...

body: One morning I woke up to go get coffee but my favorite shop had been raided by the police for manufacturing narcotics, bummer. So i went to the grocery store to find my fix of caffeine before playing endless hours of Overwatch and Call of Duty, low and behold I found the green trophy that is Monster energy. After buying one walking out the car and tasting it, I became addicted, I walked back into the store and purchased a case of them after one, two, three, then four, I was wired! I went home with four-pack in my backpack and two cans clutched in my fingers, I grabbed my controller ready to "pawn some noobs," but there was a problem, I had drank all of my Monsters so the only decision to make was to go back to the store. But my girlfriend had warned me if I drank anymore I was going to have a heart-attack, but I didn't care, I had already boarded the hype-train with the next destination Monsterville. But on the way out the door my girlfriend stopped me, I asked "What is wrong?", she said "Nothing." I had played this game before but this time I had Monster running threw my veins, I was prepared for this, so i ignored her relentless "I just think think its funny that..." defense and walked out the door. After arriving back at the house with another case and two clutched in my hand within 5 minutes flat, she was still explaining what she though was funny. It was like I had never left, I had found the counter for her defense! So i knew after that moment I had to order more! I went on my laptop and arrived at this case product, it was just what i needed! I ordered 20 of them on a monthly subscription so I will never run out!
title: The perfect defense!

body: These chews are really convenient and unlike many energy chews, they actually taste good. They have a fruity, but not overly strong flavor. They do give you a boost of energy, but don't make you feel jittery. I like the orange flavor (have not tried the other flavors). What I really like about this product is that it is made with natural sugars like brown rice sugar & stevia instead of chemical sugars like aspartame. It's really hard to find energy drinks & supplements that don't have colors or chemicals. This product is really convenient and holds up well thrown in a purse or bag. I usually only need to eat one at a time (even though the serving size is larger) to feel some benefit, but I can adjust and eat a couple if a larger boost is needed. I have Lupus & fatigue is a huge issue. These are one of the few products that do actually help.
title: good flavor & energy

body: I've been a pro/elite multisport athlete for over 25 years. As a clinician and human performance consultant, I am always interested with advances in sports medicine which includes taking another look at previous studies. The "main" ingredient of FRS is quercetin. This is typically found in grapes, apple skins, and onions. While it's good to get your nutrients from natural sources like these, while you're on the move, using sports science supplements can be better.
title: Convenient performance supplement

body: This is tastiest FRS out of the 4 flavors. I've tried the others and don't like them as much because they have a strong artificial flavor/aftertaste. This one is more like candy, and that works for me! In all honesty, I don't feel much different when I take FRS and when I don't, but my boyfriend swears by them. He'll eat two pieces before a workout, and hit PRs like it's nothing, so maybe it really works. I think it might be psychological, at least to some degree. However, if you believe these energy chews/gums/etc give you an added boost, then by all means, give this product a try.
title: Best tasting FRS

body: I had a friend who used and swore by the FRS powder after he was recovering from surgery. I decided to try the chews since they're easier to deal with. First off, they are fairly vile tasting, but you get past that pretty quickly. What I didn't get past was my tiredness. I saw NO difference after chewing two of these, as indicated, than I felt before. I don't know if they're placebo or what, but I got no benefit from them.
title: Worthless

body: I use these chews to help wake up a little in the morning, or get ready for some exercise. They don't taste like candy, but they're not bad if you don't mind sour things. I feed them to friends of mine at rehearsals and I think it helps everybody bring the energy level up a little. No crash, no bad stomach. I usually eat one at a time instead of 2- the serving size.
title: I like them

body: I understand what some people say about being over priced and you can get the main ingredients cheaper.  But, for me, I don't really care and don't want to deal with it (maybe that is bad?).  I'm make enough that I'm not worried about and it's not worth my time to find alternatives since I've tried these and like them.  They don't give you that hyper/caffeine/speed type feeling yet provide a noticeable boost in my energy level.  I have been doing a lot of biking (1-1/2 to 3 hrs per day) and I take 2 about 20 min. before I start.  I feel the rise in energy by the time I start.  I also do a LOT of travel for work and sometimes drive up to 12hrs (instead of flying, because flying is a PITA!) and when I start to feel tired while driving, I take 1 or 2 and a little bit later I feel much more awake!  So they may have even saved my life, who knows lol.  Anyway, I like them, I understand where other are coming from though and I like that they are convenient and easy to pack/carry.
title: They work for me

body: These are quite unpleasant.  They take forever to chew and get all mushy.  At first the taste isn't too bad but it's too powerful a taste and last waaayyy too long.  They definitely work, though.  I usually but the liquid concentrate, but thought I'd give these a try.  The benefits are the same, but the drink form is much nicer.
title: Not great taste but works

body: I am a runner & have struggled to find energy products that agree with my digestive system... I have stayed away from sugar for decades, so when I do ingest it, my body reacts negatively. However, no problems with this product. I recently ingested 3 chews during a 12 mile run w/no adverse reaction. Not exactly delicious, but definitely tolerable.
title: Good for athletes with sensitive  systems

body: This product is marketed as a solid replacement to a 5 hour energy shot. In reality its just a supplement for hardcore workout fanatics who have hit a plateau in their 5 hour workouts and need an extra boost (assuming they already tried everything else and nothing works). It does not give you energy. It helps metabolize the energy you have from already being in fantastic shape and eating a perfect diet. If you've done all that and still cant maintain an intense 5 hour training session, this is the last thing you can do to help give you a boost. And even at that it wont work for every workout fanatic.
title: More hype than performance.

body: I actually quite enjoy the pungent flavor and chewiness of this "candy".  If given the choice of a Godiva chocolate or a couple of these, I'd take these!  Well, to each his own.  I'm a 65 year old woman, and have been doing some very intensive gardening and landscaping this year.  I take a couple of these along with a break every few hours, and seem to have more stamina than usual, yet am not beat up the next day.  I couldn't say whether it's my imagination, or just the pleasantness of a sugar kick that gives me a boost.  Nevertheless, I'd feel uncomfortable if I couldn't reach for a couple of these when I want to work a few more hours!  I take quercetin as a supplement anyway, so don't think that's what I crave about these.  I agree, the drink is not very pleasant, and still haven't finished the first free bottle.
title: FRS Lemon Line Energy Chews - Yum!

body: Way too expensive, but PepsiCo has recently changed the formula again... they say that it hasn't changed after doing some research on it, but, considering for how many years I've been buying and drinking this stuff, I trust my taste buds more than their word.  Their new "original flavor" Amp is even more watered down from when they changed it years ago, when it had the Mountain Dew branding on it.  On top of being less fulfilling, it has a very noticeable 7Upish/fake lime/lemon after taste to it.  It also does not have as good of a crisp snap to its bite.

body: One of my two favorite flavors (if there is such a thing). I run every day and on those long run days, I eat one before and during my run (at mile 6) to make it easy to get to 13 miles. I can feel the energy boost as I push through those last few miles. I've used 4+ during an ultra/marathon and also never felt hungry during the run or low on energy as a result. Highly recommend. Especially because of the flavor (one of the better options out there) and because of the caffeine which is a huge help while running.

body: I purchased the Blueberry Pomegranate flavor and am glad I did so because it tastes great. It tastes just like their chews, except in semi-liquid form. It goes down very easily without the need for water. I find that it really does give me the energy I need to finish my race or activity. The instructions say to take it 5 minutes before, and every 45 minutes afterwards. My stomach doesn't digest stuff as quickly, so I have to experiment with how early to take it prior to a race.
title: Goes down very easily even without water, blueberry pomegranate tastes good

body: I use these on my long runs over 8 miles.  I generally take one ever 5 miles or so.  I can tell a HUGE difference with vs without GU Roctane.  The caffeine gives me a nice happy boost for the tail end of a run and with only 35mg per GU, I don't worry about it giving me the poops.
title: Absolutely works!

body: This product is fantastic.  I rode 150 miles this past Saturday, downing a Roctane every 45 minutes.  I really felt a boost, and I'm confident it helped me avoid "bonking."  I will definitely turn to Roctane for all ultra-endurance activities.
title: Powered my 150 mile bike ride

body: OMG, this product is really amazing. I ugraded from original GU to Roctance while training for my full marathon and I felt the difference. At first I thought that it will be just your regular GU but low and behold, it actually gives you that boost needed specially during the 15 plus miles. Plus it gives you mental energy as well to keep pushing and finishing your goal.
title: GU Roctane really works!

body: Seems quite good.  I use mine when I go out for or when I am just about finished with a fast bicycle ride.  That said, for me at least, I think I feel better from Hammer gel then from this. Of course this could just be me but that is all I have to go by.  I need some of this type of gel that has reasonable carbs, but not a huge amount.  You need to determine what is your need in terms of salt and carbs.  If you are at all near diabetic you have to pick wisely to keep your carbs and blood sugar in check.

body: Of the Gu flavors available this is my favorite and it has 35mg of caffeine which I like. You're never going to mistake an energy gel for actual food but this provides quick energy in a small, convenient package. I regularly do solo 200k rides and these are a good fillers between actual food stops.
title: Not Real Food or Real Tasty but Effective and Convenient

body: Love these gels. They are the only brand I use for training and marathons (half and whole). I never have stomach issues with them and they taste better than most (not that any of the gu's are delicious). They definitely work because I can feel my energy return 15 minutes or so after sucking one down.
title: Fueled a Boston Marathon

body: Almost an unfair advantage. I run a number of half marathons every year and I have recently started downing one packet of this GU around mile 8. By mile 10 it usually kicks in and really lifts the end of my race. I've also used several of these during a marathon with similar results.
title: It tastes good, not too thick and I don't get queasy ...

body: I'm fairly new to road biking. I thought I'd give this stuff a try as I'm training for my first metric century this month. Taking the GU energy gels with water kept me from bonking toward the end of my 40+ mile rides. I didn't want to just pass out and go to sleep as soon as I got home afterwards either. The flavor and texture is a bit of an acquired taste on all varieties. It also gets a little sticky on your hands, and then handle bars, and then brakes if you don't wear full finger gloves. They are very easy to carry. I put about 5 in one jersey pocket, and use the other pocket for empties until I can stop and throw them away. Sometimes you have to spend a little quality time with the packet to ensure they're empty. I haven't had any problems with it, but there is the chance you might get a little leakage in the empties. Overall, it's a good product. When I run out, I will get some more before training for any other events.
title: Pleasantly surprised

title: I've got to say most of the flavors are pretty bad especially the Cherry lime

body: If you're doing long-distance events you have to have calories and I've found Gu Roctane is the best way to get those calories. I've used this for many years for long training runs and rides and during competition in marathons and triathlons. I always feel better after I've "Gued"!
title: Gu keeps me going!

body: Great... I guess... who knows, I mean how do you measure or check the claims OR results? But, okay, they got me. I guess if the claims turn out to be false I'll get reimbursed in the class action lawsuit. Anyway, tastes the same as the regular stuff, looks the same as the regular stuff, results SEEMS to be like the regular stuff....
title: GOOD

body: I prefer the Roctane GU over the regular GU when I am running more than 10+miles or am doing something especially strenuous (think Tough Mudder/Spartan Race). Roctane definitely helps me with decreasing muscle cramping and increasing energy level.  My favorite flavors are blueberry pomegranate and cherry lime.
title: Great GU

body: Strawberry kiwi is by far my favorite roctane, with berry pomegranate in second place.  I use this one when I don't want the caffeine and the berry pomegranate when I want the little kick of caffeine.  Roctanes provide a great clean energy feeling for mountain biking and they are light to carry in my pack.
title: Awesome

body: Great for long runs.  Helps maintain sustained energy in a nutrient dense lightweight package.  Mixed flavors helpful.  Tolerated well while consuming supplemental electrolyte beverage and water, e.g. Gatorade.  GuRoctane and electrolyte beverage supplemented with beta-alanine are a good combination for doing multiple 20+ miles in a week.  The caffeine benefit is noticeable and highly desirable, may help with ibuprofen uptake.
title: GuRoctane is good stuff.

body: This was my mistake, but I didn't realize that about 1/2 of the Gu packs included in this mix are No Caffeine (Strawberry Kiwi and Lemonade- which is a shame as Lemonade is by far my favorite flavor.) The others are caffeinated. If you have a preference on this, take note.
title: Note: Not All Packs Are Caffeinated

body: I buy one of these before every race season. I like all the flavors and GU products are superior in terms of giving your body on the go full without any GI upset. I ride centuries and run ultras using these and they have never let me down or left me cramping up. That's the acid test.
title: Dead solid perfect

body: I'm fairly new to road biking. I thought I'd give this stuff a try as I'm training for my first metric century this month. Taking the GU energy gels with water kept me from bonking toward the end of my 40+ mile rides. I didn't want to just pass out and go to sleep as soon as I got home afterwards either. The flavor and texture is a bit of an acquired taste on all varieties. It also gets a little sticky on your hands, and then handle bars, and then brakes if you don't wear full finger gloves. They are very easy to carry. I put about 5 in one jersey pocket, and use the other pocket for empties until I can stop and throw them away. Sometimes you have to spend a little quality time with the packet to ensure they're empty. I haven't had any problems with it, but there is the chance you might get a little leakage in the empties. Overall, it's a good product. When I run out, I will get some more before training for any other events.
title: Pleasantly surprised

body: I've tasted many different gels and Lemonade has a very agreeable taste. I prefer the effects taking the Roctane with caffeine but the taste of the gels without caffeine are better. The consistency is like very thick lemonade. Very refreshing and not too sweet.
title: Very Refreshing and Not Too Sweet

body: Great tasting "GU" where many flavors are sort of gross.  I have used this as one of my primary energy sources during my two Ironman's last year.  The great part about this flavor is its sort of refreshing.
title: Great tasting "GU" where many flavors are sort of gross

body: This is my favorite gel!  It tastes good, has protein components and caffeine along with a good energy sugar (for me).  I do have to take a little water with it as it is a little thicker in consistency than most other gels...but I need water anyway so not a big deal.  It works for me.  A great energy source if you need one.  I also like the packaging which makes it easy to open on the bike or running with minimal effort.
title: This stuff rocks!!

body: I do a lot of running in the mornings, at least four miles, up to ten. When I do a long run (6 miles or over), I need an energy boost. Gel blocks upset my stomach, and while I'm a total coffee junkie, I don't like the feeling of it sloshing around while I run. Sheets are awesome for that, I pop one before I start running, and by the time I hit mile three, it kicks in and gets me to mile 8 without weighing me down.

body: For whatever reason this is the only MiO flavor I've tried(and I've tried nearly all of them) that somehow seems to change taste if it sits for long after mixing. And it isn't good when it does. I'll typically fill a 32oz bottle and drink throughout the day. Sometimes this tastes odd or just like it's gum that lost the flavor but still kind of has a bland taste just an hour after mixing, and sometimes it takes 7 or 8 hours into the day. The only flavor to do that, others are good the entire day or even multiple days. I've bought it numerous times thinking maybe just a bad or expired(?) batch. Nope. Same story every time. Other MiO flavors are excellent(this one would too if it'd hold flavor).
title: Loses flavor sometimes.

body: Ideal for hikers, cyclists etc, taste great and works
title: taste great and

body: One bottle of Mio CAN last you 24 bottles of water, but it probably will come up short if you like to taste it like I do. I get 12-14 bottles per Mio. At $3.99 or $4.99 or whatever price it is at the time you read this, it's a pretty expensive drink. For example, 12 cans of 12 oz Coca-cola are $3.99 in most stores...and when they go on sale you can get them for as little as $2.50. With the Mio, you are paying for the Mio PLUS the bottles of water.
title: Mio rocks, but it is a little pricey

body: Not bad, my favorite so far, though get tired of them all eventually. 4 stars since it came with spanish bottle labeling - not a bad thing, I can read enough to get by, but I had to look carefully to see there was no "hecho en mexico" lurking about. Then I'd have to rinse it first.
title: Que Paso

body: They taste is great and my pee is clear. I love to carry these around when I can't make myself drink water. I love sweet everything and it's a chore to drink 2 liters a day, especially since I'm breastfeeding. My teeth doesn't change color from any dye and my shirt didn't get messed up when I spilled it on myself. Winning!
title: I love this

body: This is my first purtchase of this flavor, to me it tastes just like lemonade, depending on the strength you use. I use about four drops to get it to the flavor strength I like. This is totally worth the price paid here, as it is so much more at my local stores, if you can find it and/or the flavor. I reccomnd this very much, if lemonade is your flavor. Amazon this should be added to the subscribe & save, to save even more. Just a suggestion.
title: Tastes just like lemonade

body: I purchased a variety of water flavorers, because of my inability to easily find zero calorie sports drinks, with the side benefit of reducing my ecological waste profile. I compared several varieties, Dasani, Mio, Propel, and Nuun, and this was my second favorite, slightly less tasty than the Dasani, easier to use than Propel powder, and anything would taste better than the Nuun.
title: Convenient, Tastes Good

body: Since it's Mio "fit" I did expect it to taste like a sports drink, but this is EXTREMELY salty. I would liken it to a 20 oz blue power aide with a tablespoon of salt in it. I tried it a few times and each time couldn't finish it. I like all the other flavors of Mio I've tried, but the berry blast fit is awful. If you REALLY want it, you might be able to mix it with a non fit flavor to help neutralize the saltiness, but I personally wouldn't risk it.
title: If you like blueberry flavored sea water, you'll love it

body: A friend gave me some of this at his house over the summer, and it seemed to be the best glass of lemonade I'd ever had.  I didn't see how that was possible, because I've regularly had the real stuff made from fresh lemons, but this was just so delicious.
title: I swear I'm addicted to this stuff after one bottle

body: I have tried almost all of the Mio favors and this one is definitely the best.  My husband who hates artificial sweeteners can drink this because it just tastes natural without that foul aftertaste.  I use it to help me drink lots of water ever day.  I only gave it 4 stars because it expensive -- especially here on Amazon.
title: Best Flavor

body: No good. I expected a lemon/lime/apply/citrus taste but just tasted sort of how you'd expect a ghostbusters mystery flavor to taste... if that makes any sense. Again, I realize now why this flavor is so hard to find in the store - it's not a great seller - I guess I'll be sticking with the real fruit flavors like tangerine/orange and black cherry in the future.
title: No good. I expected a lemon/lime/apply/citrus taste but just tasted ...

title: One of the Better Flavors

body: I'm not a Mio person, but my husband absolutely loves Lemonade Mio. It's been tough for me to get him to drink more water, and so far this has been the only way. He likes the flavor so much, he drinks it all day. Our 3-year old likes it too!

body: Lemonade is by far my favorite flavor, but as of this writing the cheapest price is $23 for 4 of them!  In stores they sell for only about $3.50, quite the markup I'd say!  So if the price is any more than $14 for 4 just go to your local store!
title: Watch Out for them being OVERPRICED

body: I love love love Mio liquid water enhancers. They add a great flavor boost to water, when you're just not in the  mood for water.  I haven't tasted a flavor that I don't like and peach mango is one of my favorites. I love that you can choose how much to put, and the bright color puts a smile on my face!
title: Yummy!

body: One bottle of Mio CAN last you 24 bottles of water, but it probably will come up short if you like to taste it like I do. I get 12-14 bottles per Mio. At $3.99 or $4.99 or whatever price it is at the time you read this, it's a pretty expensive drink. For example, 12 cans of 12 oz Coca-cola are $3.99 in most stores...and when they go on sale you can get them for as little as $2.50. With the Mio, you are paying for the Mio PLUS the bottles of water.
title: Mio rocks, but it is a little pricey

body: Among the MIO flavors, I admit that Lemonade is one of the better options.  However, if you don't love the taste of Propylene Glycol and Sucralose then this probably isn't for you.  Tastes artificial and low-cal (which it is), but I think I'll stick with the real thing.
title: Fine, if low calorie is your thing

body: I really like this stif but found out the grocery stores carry it for quite a bit less. I prefer the fruity flavors to the coffee/moca flavors.....it's a nice boost if you get bored with water in the afternoon.

body: Simply, it's the best-tasting water enhancer I've ever tried. Worth it with the dollar off coupon currently active on amazon per the time of this review.

title: Excelent! Flavorful! Conveinient!

title: helping me drink more water

body: For whatever reason this is the only MiO flavor I've tried(and I've tried nearly all of them) that somehow seems to change taste if it sits for long after mixing. And it isn't good when it does. I'll typically fill a 32oz bottle and drink throughout the day. Sometimes this tastes odd or just like it's gum that lost the flavor but still kind of has a bland taste just an hour after mixing, and sometimes it takes 7 or 8 hours into the day. The only flavor to do that, others are good the entire day or even multiple days. I've bought it numerous times thinking maybe just a bad or expired(?) batch. Nope. Same story every time. Other MiO flavors are excellent(this one would too if it'd hold flavor).
title: Loses flavor sometimes.

body: A friend told me that she used this all the time,so I bought it.This is the worst thing I've had. It has a sickly, sweetener taste, a bitter after taste and doesn't have any lemon taste at all. I'll stick with Crystal Light or ANY other stuff.
title: ICCKY!

body: I wouldn't consider myself a big drink snob, but this was my first MIO, purchased based on the reviews of others here on Amazon.  I don't like the flavor much at all, and prefer to drink other non-carbonated beverages, including water.  Occasionally I'll squirt some in my water bottle, but usually end up regretting it.  I definitely prefer a light squeeze to a heavy dose, but either way, I'm not a big fan.  Perhaps if they added a bit more tang, I'd like it more.  As it, I'd rather have Gatorade mix or something of that sort.
title: Not my preference

body: While I'm sure many "squirt a lot" that's not really my style, and for me the best flavors so far are:
title: Several flavors are excellent, particularly the mixed flavors.  Not clear how some 1.62 oz bottles are listed at more than $4.

body: This is my favorite Mio flavor hands-down.  I really like the way the sweet tea tastes and I like how you can control how much flavor you want to add so easily.  I use it with water out of our refrigerator door - I start adding some water, pause to squirt a few drops in, and then finish filling my glass.  The force of the water from the spigot mixes it flavor additive and I don't even have to stir it.  I cried when I couldn't find this flavor at our local grocery store but was so happy when I found it here on Amazon - and for a much better price!
title: Great price and good flavor

body: I've been wanting to try this for awhile and am so glad I did.  The Green Thunder is the best if you like drinks like Red Bull.  I was on a Red Bull kick for awhile now but always thought it was a bit over-priced.  When  now that I found GreenThunder, it completely matches that.  DEFINITELY, need to be careful.  I agree with others who have said this will give you a hop in your step, but doesn't cause you to crash like many coffee drinks.  Though be warned.  I kind of forgot about the caffeine and after a few drinks was totally buzzing.  The only other flavor I have tried is Fruit Punch, and it's good if you like fruit punch.  I don't but it was all they had left at the store when I was there, which should tell you something too.  I will also not be buying that flavor again.  But Kraft has a winner with this product IMHO.
title: Love it!  No more overpriced Redbull.  Hello MiOEnergy Green Thunder!!  It rocks if you like that taste

body: My personal belief is that water is for bathing.  That is, unfortunately, extremely politically incorrect and not good for my health.  I am weaning myself off diet soda and the only way I can drink water is with the peach flavored Mio.  Our stores have quit carrying this flavor so I was ecstatic to find it on Amazon.  I am using less of it than when I originally started.  I have tried other brands but none of them taste as good as the Mio.
title: Thank you, Amazon, for carrying this!

body: I've been trying a few different flavors from MIO. A few I like but the strawberry watermelon taste awful. I threw it in the garbage. It taste like chemicals with a hint of strawberry.
title: Strawberry watermelon is gross

body: I love being able to order things I use often.  I live a ways from stores, so I do a lot of shopping online.  It is great to get items I use sent right to my door and I don't have to travel 20 to 50 miles to get these products.  The cherry is my very favorite flavor, and it must be for others.  It seems like whenever I do make it to the store, that is the one that is always out.
title: Great

body: Assuming I'd love this flavor, I went ahead and bought two. I mixed up the solution (I prefer a paler consistency so its flavor isn't too strong) and was disappointed to find that there really is no flavor there. Until the aftertaste hits you... At first, it tasted like chalk. But the more I considered the taste, I found a better comparison. If you crushed several Tylenol tablets and swallowed the powder in a dry mouth, you'd get the same after as the Mio's aftertaste. YUCK! I can't tell you how disappointed I was considering Mio started this liquid water enhancer craze. I expected SO much more. I will never buy a Mio again.
title: Horrible aftertaste!

body: I just love the black cherry flavor. It brings back childhood memories of the crappy maraschino cherries that came on top of ice cream sundaes, and the snow cones with cherry flavored syrup slathered on top. People like my wife think this flavor tastes like cough syrup, so it's definitely not for everyone.

body: I love this flavor in particular.  I love Tang but it's SO much sugar.  They don't make sugar free Tang (you'd think they would in this day and age).  This flavor, Orange Tangerine, is the closest I've been able to come to a diet Tang and it doesn't have Aspartame or Saccharin, both sweeteners I stay away from.  There is an orange only flavor but that's not the same as this one.  If you want a diet Tang, this is what I have found is the closest to it.
title: Taste as close to diet Tang as you can get

body: I've been wanting to try this for awhile and am so glad I did.  The Green Thunder is the best if you like drinks like Red Bull.  I was on a Red Bull kick for awhile now but always thought it was a bit over-priced.  When  now that I found GreenThunder, it completely matches that.  DEFINITELY, need to be careful.  I agree with others who have said this will give you a hop in your step, but doesn't cause you to crash like many coffee drinks.  Though be warned.  I kind of forgot about the caffeine and after a few drinks was totally buzzing.  The only other flavor I have tried is Fruit Punch, and it's good if you like fruit punch.  I don't but it was all they had left at the store when I was there, which should tell you something too.  I will also not be buying that flavor again.  But Kraft has a winner with this product IMHO.
title: Love it!  No more overpriced Redbull.  Hello MiOEnergy Green Thunder!!  It rocks if you like that taste

body: Assuming I'd love this flavor, I went ahead and bought two. I mixed up the solution (I prefer a paler consistency so its flavor isn't too strong) and was disappointed to find that there really is no flavor there. Until the aftertaste hits you... At first, it tasted like chalk. But the more I considered the taste, I found a better comparison. If you crushed several Tylenol tablets and swallowed the powder in a dry mouth, you'd get the same after as the Mio's aftertaste. YUCK! I can't tell you how disappointed I was considering Mio started this liquid water enhancer craze. I expected SO much more. I will never buy a Mio again.
title: Horrible aftertaste!

body: A friend told me that she used this all the time,so I bought it.This is the worst thing I've had. It has a sickly, sweetener taste, a bitter after taste and doesn't have any lemon taste at all. I'll stick with Crystal Light or ANY other stuff.

body: I was very unimpressed with this product. When adding a few drops to a bottle of water- sure it changes the color to a light carmel color and provides a sweet tea taste- but there is nothing natural or healthy about this product. It is all processed and fake ingredients. The product does not have a caffeine boost like sweet tea should- on the other hand though it does provide flavor to your water. If you are not going to drink water without being flavored or if you have kids who will only drink water that is colored because of perceptions of being "like soda" this product would not be of harm.
title: When adding a few drops to a bottle of water- sure it changes the color to a light carmel color and provides a sweet tea taste-
